characters: NEAR THE TOP OF THE HILL
MOVING CLOSER AND CLOSER TO KORDA
ROPER IN THE BED OF THE TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT ROPER
dialogues.text: He's listening to the stretch call of a horse race, and h into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...at the top of the stretch it's  Cozy Girl in front with Backtrack  coming on... Cozy Girl by a length,  Backtrack closing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Stay up there, Cozy Girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA GRADUALLY pulls back to reveal that Roper is  driving his Trans Am across the Bay Bridge. HELICOPTER SH give a soaring view of the San Francisco skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the eighth pole it's Cozy Girl by  half a length... Backtrack closing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper's police radio SQUAWKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-one-four to Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dig in, Cozy Girl... (into the radio) Roper go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-four, Roper. Code 2.C.P. 4th and  Grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Cozy Girl holding on... Cozy  Girl and Backtrack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm en route. E.T.A. in five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the radio down. Punches the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay up there, Girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cozy Girl in front by a neck... Now  a head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weaving through traffic on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the damn wire?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes the wire... and...  Backtrack gets up in the last jump.  Cozy girl a very game second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trans Am streak off toward the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hostage situation. Police barricades. Dozens of squad c ambulances, spectators, SWAT team. It's a stalemate. Rope Trans Am pulls to a stop at the barricades. He hops out,  weaves through the spectators and past the barriers. A FEMALE DETECTIVE, EIKO KIMURA, rushes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Kimura. Where's the command post?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimura points to the diner in the middle of the block. Ro heads toward it. As they walk Kimura briefs him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suspect came in shortly after  the bank opened. Botched robbery. A  teller hit the silent alarm. He took  seven hostages. Shot one -- the guard.  He's still alive. So far he's asked  for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, and a plane waiting at  the airport. If he doesn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...get 'em, he's going to start  shooting hostages in five minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the suspect's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across from the bank. This is where the "command post" is setup. About a dozen cops and the accompanying support st are here. Lieutenant SAMUEL BAFFERT is in charge. Roper  saunters in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Roper. Glad you could join  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper walks over to the counter where Baffert is standing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have a profile on Mr. Earl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert hands him a folder. Roper opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy is no genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper scans the profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not usually graduate students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT wants to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the rush? They haven't killed  anybody yet this week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper refers to the folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a guy who's probably on drugs.  He's got a record of 459's and he  was busted on possession. But he's  never been busted on a major felony.  What's his demeanor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's a little fucking agitated --  he ripped the phone out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- you can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got 7 hostages in there, 1 of  them's wounded -- We don't know how  bad it is -- The guy ripped the phone  out -- SWAT said he's got a gun to  the head of a female hostage. If  SWAT makes entry now, you're gonna  lose 1 hostage, maybe 2. I gotta go  in. Maybe I can see what's going on  in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's never offed anybody. His rap  doesn't show any violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that we know of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know how much time we have.  If I can get in to talk to him --  maybe we won't lose anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can get a throw phone in  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT says it's broken -- The perp in  the last situation rendered it  inoperable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He urinated on it and shorted out  the circuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna stand here and talk about  it or let the guy in there bleed to  death. (beat... beat) Give me a dozen donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper pulls out his gun and places it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper eats the donut as he crosses toward the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A team of two SWAT TEAM MEMBERS, FORBES IS A SPOTTER AND  MCCALL IS A SHARPSHOOTER. KEVIN MCCALL, is the one we're  interested in. He's 25 years old, handsome, all American. He's the best the SWAT team has. He crouches motionless, staring through the scope of his  rifle, watching as Roper calmly walks toward the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think he's got in the  bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't take a guy down with a  donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense situation. A wild-eyed, white punk, fuck-up of a  BANK ROBBER, EARL, is holding a pretty, young TELLER arou the neck with a cocked gun held to her temple. The other bank employees are cowering on the floor. A few are giving aid to the wounded bank guard who is half-cons and oozing blood from his side. Roper strolls right through the front door and walks towa Earl, very sociable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Earl, I'm Scott Roper. Wanna  donut? I ate the glazed but there's  a bunch of chocolate and a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl swipes the donuts out of Roper's hand and starts fri Roper for weapons with his free hand. The other hand stil has the gun poised at the young teller's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a negotiator, Earl. I don't carry  a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper smiles reassuringly at the pretty teller. It seems help. Earl finishes patting Roper down, straightens back and puts his hand around the teller's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get something straight  first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper looks over at the other bank employees huddled on t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A balding, middle-aged MAN sheepishly raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper takes a step toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you start keeping longer  hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really! Because I've been thinking  of moving to this branch. It would  be really convenient for me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY, SHUT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl wags his gun against the Teller's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to start killing  people?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper holds his hand up defensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job to see that no one gets  killed, Earl... Including you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where's my FUCKING car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl is pouring sweat. His gun hand is shaking uncontroll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting it, Earl, but we have to  do this the right way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper keeps his eyes locked on Earl. His voice is calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I need you to point that gun  away from -- (to the teller) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice trembling) Debbie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point the gun away from Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie's brains are going to be  splattered all over the floor if I  don't see a car in five minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper takes a long look at Earl. The guy is a hair trigge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright! But let's be clear about  one thing. If you kill someone, I  can't help you. The SWAT guys will  take you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl glances at the army of cop cars poised outside. Refl for a moment on the reality of the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are my chances of getting out  of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper calmly moves toward where the wounded guard is layi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. Last month, a guy robbed a  bank in Daly City...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper crouches down, smiles at the blurry-eyed guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard groans. He's not doing very well. Roper peels b the bloody handkerchief, takes a look. Winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Earl) ...Cops gave him a car, and he lost  them on the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl is encouraged by that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Bank robbers are generally  your smartest criminals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper looks directly into Earl's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't kill anybody, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper bends over the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the guard under the arms and starts dragging him across the floor. The guard MOANS piteously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, leave him alone. What are you  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper keeps dragging the guard toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's part of my negotiator's oath.  If there's an injured party and I  can help them, I'm duty bound by my  oath to do that. You can shoot me if  you want, but the next negotiator in  here is going to tell you the same  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl is unsure what to do, but he guesses an oath is an o He lets Roper drag the guard to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back, Earl. Point that  gun away from Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl compliantly moves the gun away from the teller's hea then re-thinks and jerks it back against her temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper drags the guard out the front door and deposits him the sidewalk. Two SWAT OFFICERS rush up to give aid. One them is Jennings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Jennings) Give me your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NOTE: The method of disarming Earl is still to be determ Jennings inconspicuously pulls his gun out and slips it t him. Roper quickly cocks it and shoves it in his waistban under his shirt and vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't had to shoot anyone in  three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not keep the streak alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because this strung-out junkie is  too stupid to get out of this without  killing somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl watches Roper through the window. He can only see Ro back. He's getting very agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) HEY, WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU DOING OUT  THERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cops hustle off with the wounded guard, and Roper calmly walks back into the bank. Stops about five paces f Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a rule, I need one hostage released  as show of good faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper glances at Debbie. Gun pressed against her head. Te start rolling down her cheeks. She's being tremendously b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl squeezes the gun even tighter against the side of he head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the old guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other hostages watch this exchange tensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Guy? What kind of show of  faith is that? I want Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I gettin' the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gettin' the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl thinks about it, his gun hand twitching. He points a two of the female employees cowering against the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper decides that this is the best he's going to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two, leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women don't need any extra encouragement. They ju up and rush out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall and Forbes watch through their rifle scopes as the two released hostages are whisked away by uniformed cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fine, Earl. Now I'm going  to get your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper turns around and walks toward the front door. He st and looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's one last thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl looks like he's right on the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a convertible or hardtop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl thinks about that for a beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardtop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper turns around, starts walking again. He keeps his ey focused on the reflection of Earl in the front window of bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning around) Manual or automatic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one swift motion, Roper turns, aims and FIRES!... One SHOT. It tears into Earl's shoulder. One inch from  Debbie's neck. Earl is blown back against the counter. De shrieks at the top of her lungs. SWAT guys pour in from every entrance. YELLING for everyb to "GET DOWN"! Pointing guns. They pounce on Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give up! I give up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper goes to Debbie, puts his arm around her and gently  leads her out of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall and Forbes still have their rifles trained on the  bank door. Their police radio squawks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation is secured. Suspect in  custody. Repeat. Situation secured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall lowers his rifle as Roper guides Debbie through th wave of cops rushing into the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper is exiting the bank and putting back on his gun whe he hears the sound of a CAMERA SHUTTER. He turns to see  VERONICA (RONNIE) TATE holding the camera. She snaps one Roper with Earl in the b.g. being placed in a squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one for the front page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper puts his hand over his heart as if stricken with lo which he in fact is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie, why are you torturing me? I  can't live without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie rolls her eyes. She doesn't take Roper all that  seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slings the camera over her shoulder and starts to wal off. Roper dogs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This baseball player you're going  out with... (shaking his head) He's no good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?! He's a wonderful guy. He  makes two million a year, and he  worships me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worship you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worship yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie, forget this what's-his-name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know he's already got a bad  knee? In another 10 years you're  going to be pushing him around in a  wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie stops. Looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I think? I think you  only want me now, because I'm with  somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares what you think. I want you  back and that's all that matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie smiles, but offers no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take you out tomorrow night...  Pleeease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out with Greg tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning) This Greg is really getting in my  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper gets down on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'm begging you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I've got to get a shot of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the lense cap off her camera. Roper primps his  hair to make sure he looks good for the picture... CLICK! Suddenly Roper notices that his Trans Am is being towed. rushes over to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPO MAN stands off to the side watching dispassionatel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. Now it belongs to Silver  Hills Financial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper sadly watches the tow truck drive off with his belo Trans Am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of activity. Officers in cubicles; talking on phones typing reports on computers. Most are plain-clothed. Rope weaves through the room. Passes by Baffert's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Baffert, what's the story for  tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert pulls two tickets for the Warriors' game out of h pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floor seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner's on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet contrast to the squadroom. This is the executive  branch of Metro. All the big-wigs are officed here. Roper walks down the carpeted hall. No one here except Kevin Mc quietly sitting outside Captain Solis' office. Roper and  McCall make brief eye contact. Roper thinks nothing of it He goes into the Captain's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN FRANK SOLIS is on the phone. There's a file on th desk in front of him. He motions Roper to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just walked into my office. (looks over at Roper) The Chief says, "Good work this  morning. Congratulations."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper smiles as he sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to give me a raise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) He says, "Thank you very much." (a beat) I'll discuss it with him right now...  Good-bye, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solis hangs up. Looks across the desk at Roper. A long pa He knows he's got leverage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to make this hard for  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been some concern about you  continuing to work without back-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Define concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solis dumps his cards on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you die and no one can do  what you do as well as you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your concern is heartwarming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been decided that you take on  another partner and train him to be  able to take over for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what the guy in the Sunday  School suit is doing outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Kevin McCall. Every Metro  Captain agrees that he's their top  sharp-shooter and most likely to  succeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper grabs McCall's folder off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper scans it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tested high on his intellectual  aptitude... Not as high as me but...  National marksman finalist... Attended  N. Y. C... Went to college. Very  impressive. F.B.I. sniper school...  Mayorial commendation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall turns around in his chair. He can see Roper and So through the glass walls of the office, but he can't hear  their voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Additional Skills": Biathelete,  marathoner, lip-reading, speaks  Spanish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper throws the folder back on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, send him to the Marines. This  guy's not a negotiator. He'll quit  in two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let us worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there going to be an expression  of your appreciation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gloomily) What kind of appreciation are we  talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The financial kind. I figure I'm  going to be working extra hours. All  sorts of overtime... training  sessions... Not to mention the extra  stress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think would be in order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like ahh... I don't know... (boldly) Five thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Okay, I think I could swing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh, Roper thinks maybe he sold short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) And a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you just got a five thousand  dollar raise. Get a car of your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you've got nothing but cars  down there in impound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impound isn't a rent-a-car company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) The car is part of the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your Trans Am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solis gets up and taps the glass, motions for McCall to c in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repoed this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relenting) I'll provide you with transportation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And even if this doesn't work, I  want all the money. These SWAT guys  don't have the temperament. They  don't have the background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall enters the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (instant character  change) Hey, glad to meet you. I've heard  nothing but good things about you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper reaches out. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here. I've watched you in action.  Very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a lot of hard work ahead  of you if you want to be a negotiator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready to do it. (a beat) And I'm going to be here more than  two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper's face darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go reading my lips, man. That's  an intrusion. Save that shit for the  sniper school. Comprende?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... Habit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intervening) Let's move past this, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're already past it, aren't we,  Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll have to excuse me. I  have other work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall head out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the transportation issue...  You check with the impound sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper smiles. Total victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING with Roper and McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been in a hostage situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only at the very end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel after a shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-assured) Like it had to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the squadroom, wind through the cubicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It rarely has to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've rarely shot anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT is a lifesaving unit, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at Roper's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, "Dead Eye", lesson one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper grabs an empty soda bottle from a neighboring desk. takes the cap off a ball point pen and drops it into the  empty bottle. He places the bottle on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extract that pen cap without touching  or moving the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall looks at the bottle quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little exercise in lateral thinking.  The obvious solution isn't always  the only solution... See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper grabs his jacket and walks off, leaving McCall to p the problem. McCall looks over at another cop who has bee observing. The cop shrugs his shoulders. He hasn't got a  clue. McCall sits down and thoughtfully peers into the bo

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and Baffert walking past the row of cars, including Solis' cadillac, searching for Roper's "new" transportati Roper is holding the keys in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if we make a stop on the way?  We busted Frank Antonucci on  possession. He gave us a lead on  that Polk Street jewelry heist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Phoney Frank"? Don't waste your  time. He'd tell you his granny was  in on the Kennedy assassination if  he could dodge a collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still gotta do it. Wasting time is  half my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper is looking at the numbered parking spaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This SWAT guy might be a good idea.  He may be able to take a little  pressure off you. I worry about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worried about me, too? The chief's  worried about me. Solis is worried  about me. Maybe you guys should start  some kind of organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of which. I saw you talking  to Ronnie this morning. Why can't  you get it back together with her.  You've gotta be out of your mind not  to get with that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not me. It's her. She's going  out with this baseball player --  Greg Barnett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) No shit! He's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him. He swings at anything in  the dirt. I could strike him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give up on her. You're getting  to the age when you ought to be  thinking about these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper bends over like an old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, my rheumatism's been acting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at their destination. A parking space with a  1957 DODGE PICKUP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. Space 742.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper looks at the pickup truck in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he didn't say 742. He must have  said 724 or something, because this  can't be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert unlocks the pickup and offers the keys to Roper w is crossing to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man! What am I, Red Foxx? I'm not  riding in this shit. I can't roll in  no shit like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the keys from Baffert who moves around to the  passengers side. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the stereo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the stereo. What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Just get in. We gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup in traffic.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a four story twenties style walk-up. It's evening no The pickup pulls to a stop out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert pulls out a slip of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apartment 306.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to go up with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, It probably won't turn up  anything. I'm just gonna talk to  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I don't want to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert gets out. Roper grabs his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want anything on the game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Warriors plus 6 this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take half of your action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert goes into the building. Roper dials his cellular  phone. Beep! Beep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A message on the display reads: RECHARGE BATTERY. Roper looks around. There's a payphone across the street. gets out of the truck and crosses to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third floor hallway. Nice, middle class place. Well kept Baffert walks over to room 306. Knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz is playing. MICHAEL KORDA sits motionless in a chair listening to the music. There's a KNOCK. Korda responds a if pulled from a trance. He rises and moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Lieutenant Sam Baffert from the  San Francisco Police Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slight hesitation from Korda. He glances around the  apartment. For what reason, we don't know. Maybe to make  sure there's nothing incriminating around. He opens the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I come in? I would just like to  ask you a couple of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda steps aside and lets Baffert enter. Korda closes th door. Baffert scans the place. Not bad. He listens to the music. A smile grows on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count Basie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda smiles back. Another jazz aficionada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Ellington. "Things Ain't What  They Used To Be", recorded July 30,  1945.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Yeah... Now I can hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda goes to the stereo, turns it down. Duke Ellington p low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you find an old recording  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used record shop down on Turk Street.  I was in there looking for some Robert  Johnson. (searching for the  name) Memories... Memory Lane or  something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to stop in there... Mr.  Korda, do you know Frank Antonucci?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Frank who owns the bakery  down the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is a different Frank. This  is a man who deals in jewelry. Stolen  jewelry usually. You wouldn't know  anybody like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda drifts to the other side of the room. Takes a look his front window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody there. Just the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says it as if the very idea disturbs him. He turns awa from the window. Baffert feigns a coughing spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I please have a little water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the perfect host) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda heads toward the kitchen area. Baffert uses this as opportunity to drift around the room. Do a little snoopin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I'm asking you is because  we arrested him with some stolen  jewelry. It was traced to the robbery  of a store down on Polk Street. He  said he was fencing it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert notices something in the trash can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several glassine envelopes used for raw jewels. They have jeweler's markings on them indicating gem weight and grad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda, pouring the water, notices Baffert's discovery, bu his face betrays nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) There's obviously some mistake. I  have a cousin who has had run-ins  with the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda re-enters the room with the glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps for his own reasons he  entangled me in this... situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cousin of yours... What's his  name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forthrightly) Clarence Teal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a beat. Korda is still holding th water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cough seems to be better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real repressed tension here. Someone's about to get hur Baffert takes the glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a sip. Korda watches him like a cobra. Baffert p the glass down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm on my way to the game. I  appreciate your cooperation, Mr.  Korda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda smiles. Baffert walks to the door. Opens it to leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe that story about Robert  Johnson...? That he made a deal with  the devil at the crossroads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert muses along with Korda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert moves off down the hall and Korda closes his door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert gets into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert takes out his cell phone. Dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the elevator  descends) Hello, Judge Stone... This is  Lieutenant Samuel Baffert. I'm at a  suspect's residence. I'm requesting  a telephonic search warrant in  connection with an armed robbery at  a jewelry store. There's visible  evidence on the premises. Glassine  envelopes with jeweler's markings  were seen in the trash can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator hits the first floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I believe a full search of the  premises will turn up some stolen  property...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens. Korda is standing there with a knife. Baffert has no time to react... The knife hand slashes forward... Stabbing the chest and  slashing across the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda calmly exits the building as Roper crosses the stre returning from the payphone. Neither of the men take any  particular notices of each other. A WOMAN carrying her  groceries enters the building. Roper gets to the truck. A SCREAM from inside the buildin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baffert is laying in the open elevator, knife wounds to h neck and chest. Roper rushes over to him. It doesn't look good. The woman with the groceries is standing halfway up the f flight of stairs. Frozen. Roper pulls out his gun and rus by her up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the woman) Get an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper arrives at the top of the stairs. Korda's door is a Duke Ellington can be heard faintly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper nudges the door open, takes a step inside, gun read No one there. Suddenly, from the hallway, the click of a  door. Roper races out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper sprints to the door at the end of the hall, KICKS i open. Gun aimed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A five year old stares up at him. Scared stiff. Roper hol up a reassuring hand, and, as quickly as he arrived, he  leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper burst out the front. Down the stairs to the sidewal Looks both ways down the street... Realizes in dismay tha Korda is long gone. A SIREN approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle outside window to Roper sitting in a chair by the w looking out to the rain. Solis is in the b.g. on the phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yes sir. Every resource will be  brought to bear. We will find this  guy... Yeah, he's here now. I'll  tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solis hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chief says to tell you how sorry  he is. He knew Sam Baffert was a  good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still looking out  window) He said he was just going up to talk  to him. He said... (beat; turning to  Solis) I want to be put on this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatic) I want to be put on this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't assign you to this.  You're much too close to it. You  were much too close to Sam. The  department will take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's running it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's running it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimura and Glass will head the  investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott. Go home. Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper pauses at the door. Then pulls out two basketball  tickets and lays them on the table in Solis' office. He e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two detectives. A female named KIMURA and a tall guy name GLASS, try to make a getaway as they see Roper coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper intercepts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything on Korda so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solis said to keep you clear of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper responds louder than necessary with a half turn tow Solis' hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn what Solis said. (to the detectives) If you get a lead, I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper's pickup drives by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thru the windshield. We see Roper as the windshield wiper flap back and forth. His face seems dazed and lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper knocks. Ronnie's cheerful voice can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper makes no effort to pull himself together. The door  opens and Ronnie's face registers surprise. She's dressed casually in jeans, a nice shirt, but wears make-up and  earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey yourself. Came by to see Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like hell) A little late for that, Scottie.  He's asleep. (smells his breath) Jack Daniels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not drunk. Yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, sympathetic, but doesn't leave the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie opens the door reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper enters. Instantly we see he's at home here. He hang his coat in the closet, puts his keys on the table, notic a photograph on the wall. Quite imposing. Very unique sty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a new picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 4 months old. I'm working in a  new style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper gazes at it indifferently. He falls silent. Thought turned inward. Suddenly, TROY, (the dog), bounds in. He's ecstatic to see Roper. He puts his front paws on the couc and his head in Roper's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Troy. How ya doin' boy? (to Ronnie) He heard my voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper smiles briefly, pats the dog, taking comfort from h presence. His words are light. His tone isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the good dog. I miss you buddy.  You miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie watches them, suddenly showing the sadness she's  carefully buried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He misses me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. A moment's silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't stay long. I had to talk to  someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit surprised at  his openness) You don't usually talk to anyone  when you're hurting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my fault. I was right  downstairs. I should have gone up  with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, You can't save everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've proved that, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not coming closer. She wants to, but she won't do i She seems uneasy, glances towards the door. Roper rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hell, forget it. This won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gentle) What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I guess I can't have  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to make me feel guilty.  The whole time we were together, you  went out of your way to prove you  didn't need me. Now, suddenly, for  one night, you need me again. I can't  do it. I can't be more than your  friend. Because I know what will  happen. In a few weeks you'll be  back on top, and you'll shut me out  just as soon as you don't need me  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, hurt) You think I didn't need you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you did, you never showed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for her and she looks like she might give in t him, but at that moment there's a KNOCK ON THE DOOR. Ronn pulls back, confused and guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expecting someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her silence is the answer... A flash of pain from Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This day just keeps getting better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie watches as he searches for his keys in his pockets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) They're on the table where you always  leave them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the keys as she opens the door. GREG stands outs waiting. He's a big, good looking guy with a smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, I thought maybe you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg's smile fades as he sees Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper strides past Greg who remains in the doorway. Ronni makes brief eye contact with Greg, but then moves past hi to follow Roper. She calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie... take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper doesn't look back. He just goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge warehouse. Sun coming up over the East Bay, CLAREN TEAL rides up on a HARLEY MOTORCYLE, carrying a large cup coffee to go. He enters the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car and Boat parts stacked in aisles ten feet high. Clare shuffles through to his watchman's quarters which are  connected to the end of the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Built on pilings with a panoramic view of the bay. Korda waiting behind the door as Clarence enters. He seizes Cla from behind and slams him against the wall and spins him  around. Hot coffee soaks the front of Clarence's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you weren't family I'd kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence is scared. He offers no defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told Antonucci that shit came  from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that we could get the best price.  He's got respect for you. He's gonna  try to lowball me, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda tosses Clarence down onto the cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking idiot! Why do you think  I use you?... To be a walking  advertisement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mike. I never heard of  LaMarra flipping on anyone before.  He said he had the cops paid off.  Antonucci never flipped on anyone  before. He had the cops paid off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the fucking cop that showed up  at my door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears start to come to Clarence's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence sincerely feels bad. It's kind of touching in a  twisted way. Korda moves over to the window to keep from  striking Clarence again. He looks off across the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it! I still needed to case  that fucking store. It's too risky  to show my face now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a couple thousand bucks. You  could leave town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave town? They're going to know me  in fucking Des Moines now!... (a beat) They got over ten million in jewels  in that place. That's freedom, man.  I could go anywhere I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence watches Korda warily. Things are beginning to ad up in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill him, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda turns to Clarence with a penetrated stare that answ the question. Clarence is shaken by that. He starts to wh again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mike. I'm really sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking major fear here... Korda moves to him and we think he's going to bash him ar again, but, surprisingly, he hugs Clarence's head against his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault you're stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears of relief from Clarence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper enters the squadroom. His mood is contained. He wal to a desk where Kimura and Glass are huddling. A couple desks over, McCall is reclining in Roper's chair reading a book entitled, "Strategies and Counter Measures Hostage Situations". On the desk in front of him is the b with the pen cap still in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kimura and Glass) What do you got on Korda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ran a search on relatives. He has  a cousin in town -- Clarence Teal.  Smalltime thief. Last known address  was on Pine Street. He moved out a  month ago. We've got a couple leads  on him to check out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapid fire) Did you check out DMV for any vehicles  registration?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being faxed over now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the record room for any  incident reports? He might be a  victim. We can get medical records.  Check with burglary detail and see  if anyone else knows him, knows his  habits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about bars? We can talk to  neighbors to see what bars he  frequents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper, we're into it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Solis appears at their side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had this conversation once,  Roper. You're not active on this  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper looks at him icily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in everyone's best interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall, Kimura, Glass all watch this confrontation tensel After a beat, Roper gives in. Indicates his compliance. S heads back to this office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softened) You guys are doing good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward the desk. McCall gets up when he sees him coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your friend. I had a  friend in SWAT killed. I know how it  can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your concern. Let's  leave it at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall respectfully drops it. Roper looks down at the sod bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see much progress here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall holds up a finger. Not so fast. He picks up a pot  from a nearby "Mr. Coffee" machine. It's filled with wate He takes the water and slowly pours it into the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOTTLE
dialogues.text: The pen cap floats to the top and McCall plucks it out wi touching or moving the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice... You get an "A". Notice...  No force required. No damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a SERGEANT calls to Roper across the squadroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper, domestic disturbance at 472  6th Street. Possible hostage  situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall grabs his duffel bag. Roper starts away from the d then notices the book on "Hostage Strategies". He looks a the title, then makes a demonstration of dropping it in t trash can. He and McCall head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup is weaving through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start on one of those air freshener evergreen trees hangi from the rear view mirror. PULL BACK to show a police bub flashing on the dashboard. Roper weaving through traffic. McCall is sitting calmly a ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, McCall, how come you ended up in  San Francisco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They recruited me. Promised me fast  advancement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recruited you from where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Marksman Competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your qualifications you must  have had a lot of offers. Why here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furthest point I could find from New  York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spent my whole life there. I just  wanted to get out for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd never been out of New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been to Toronto. My mother was born  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you like Toronto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a real excitable sort, aren't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You caught me on an "up" day. (a beat) How about you? How did you end up in  San Francisco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I grew up in Oakland... Crossed the  Bay Bridge and here I was. (a beat) So you're looking for "fast  advancement".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Patrol Cars are parked in front of an unappealing apartment building. A crowd has begun to gather. UNIFORME POLICEMEN hold them back. TWO COPS are questioning a man  wearing only green slacks. No shirt. No shoes. Just the  slacks. He is very agitated. The pickup screeches up. Roper and McCall hop out. Roper  flashes his badge to the OFFICER in charge. (OFFICER #1)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper. Metro Division. Hostage  Negotiator. Give me the short version.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Husband came home. Found that guy  and his wife "in flagrante". Now  he's holding her at knife point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer points up to the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one with the bars on the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper nods. Walks back over to the pickup. Looks up. Eyeb the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we gonna get him out of there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could fill it with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper throws him a look. McCall walks to the back of the  pickup, reaches into the cab and digs around in his duffe bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Officer #1) Have you evacuated anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only that floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the hostage injured?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. She keeps screaming to  stay out. He keeps screaming to stay  out. We decided to stay out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's a good amount of  agreement on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall slams the truck door, sniper rifle in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take "highground" until SWAT  gets here. (surveying the area) I can get a good sight-line from  that roof across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall marches off across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Quick Draw, we're trying  to limit the force here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall calls back over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, a scream echoes down from the third floor window. Roper heads for the front door of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall bounds up the stairs of the building to the roofto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screams are getting more panicky. Roper comes down th hall quickly. The door to the apartment is open. It's bee that way since the guy in the green slacks fled. Roper hu toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WIFE is in bra and panties and the HUSBAND is 6'4". H giving her a good beating. It's a studio apartment. Unmad bed. Belongings strewn all over. Window open with sun  streaming in, and a good view of the building across the  street. We hear ROPER'S VOICE from out in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming in. I'm not armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The husband snatches his wife by the hair and holds a kni to her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrieking) No, Raymond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Roper) Stay the fuck out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Roper steps into the apartment. Sees the wife. Face  swollen. Knife to her neck. The enraged husband, contempl murder. One inch from committing the act. Roper doesn't b an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how you feel, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know shit, and I suggest  you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the knife against the wife's throat. She wince Her chest heaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave, Ray. It's part of my  negotiator's oath. Once I'm in the  room with the hostage, I have to  stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to see what I'm going  to do to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you something, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper reaches into his pocket and pulls out his wallet. H extracts a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wife. Two kids. A little dog-eared. Nice touch.

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: holds it up so Raymond can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing happened to me, man. She  cheated on me, but I forgave her.  You know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't interested in your life story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was partially to blame. I  wasn't around as much as I should  have been. I forgot how to love her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the one to blame. Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In prone position. Rifle in hand. Eye to scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Raymond's open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone where we left them. Roper looks at Ray with utte sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, think about how she looked when  you married her. Think about how  happy you were. Don't lose that,  man. Don't give up everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I giving up? I'm laid off  last year. I'm down to my last  unemployment check. I'm out on the  streets looking for work and this  bitch is banging some asshole in my  bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Ray is crying. Blubbering actually. And he's not  that coherent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm down at Consolidated and I'm  begging. I'm saying I'll take half  my pay. Eight years, man. I don't  even have to work the loading docks  anymore. I'll do maintenance. "We're  cutting back. We're streamlining,  Ray. West Central's running things  now. It's out of our hands" Fuck  them! Fuck them! FUCK THEM! (deep sigh) I'm gonna kill her and then I'm gonna  kill myself, 'cause I don't wanna  live anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper reaches out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, if you walk out of here with  me, I'll get you a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what? Cleaning toilets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't guarantee you what it will  be. But I swear on my life, I'll  find you work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why the fuck would you do that  for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for you, Ray. For me. A close  friend of mine was killed this week.  The way I figure it, I stop you from  doin' what you said, I'm one up on  body count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you, Mother Teresa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Scott Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stares blankly at Roper's outstretched hand, the knif clutched tightly in his fist... The wife squeezes her eye closed. Everything waits for an excruciatingly long beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need my coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on a coat rack in the corner. But to get there he ha to pass by the window. Ray drops his wife on the bed, tur and goes to get his coat. He crosses in front of the window... Reaches for the coat POP! A bullet slams into his skull. Ray falls to the floo The wife runs out of the room, screaming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOO!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes over to Ray. Circle of blood soaking into the  carpet. Ray's empty eyes. His hand still wrapped in his c He was dead instantly. Roper slams his fist into the wall couple of cops, guns drawn, arrive at the doorway. Roper  bolts out of the room... Pounds down the hallway... Pound down the stairs... down another flight... EXT. APT. BLDG. McCall comes across the street. Roper sees McCall, cool a ever. Rifle slung over his shoulder. Roper steps into his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHO THE FUCK DO YOU THINK YOU ARE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall gives no answer. He pushes past Roper and continue into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper follows, screaming his head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think because the police  department issued you a sniper rifle,  it makes you God! What the fuck goes  on in your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall, still stone-faced, reaches the apartment. Yellow  "crime scene" tape is being placed across the doorway. Co are tiptoeing around, surveying evidence. McCall ducks un the tape. Roper follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall goes over to Ray's body. Crouches down. Roper come up behind him. McCall picks up the coat covering Ray's ar Clutched in Ray's hand is a gun "Saturday night special"  variety. McCall looks up at Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT is a lifesaving unit, remember?  I just saved a life. Yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper doesn't miss a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still angry) You think I've never had a gun pulled  on me?! You think every fucking time  someone pulls a gun they use it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty-five percent of domestic  disturbances of this nature end in  murder/suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fiercely) Not the ones I'm at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall and Roper glare at each other. Toe to toe. A beat. McCall's face softens just perceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. My mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out of the room. Roper whips the sheet off the b contemplates the gun gripped in Ray's hand... Then tosses the sheet over Ray's dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper seated in the hallway, waiting outside a door marke "Internal Affairs". Things are quiet. Roper stares at the floor. Waiting. The door opens. McCall comes out, escorted by two interna affairs INVESTIGATORS. One of the investigators pats him the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a clean shoot. Go home  and get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall shakes hands with the investigators and they disap back into the office. Roper approaches McCall. He's coole off considerably. Even a tad friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's go for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really like to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to. It's a tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if I have to, I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neighborhood bar. Roper and McCall are playing pool. Ha finished beers are on a nearby table. McCall is bent over the table trying to make a particularly tricky shot. Rope studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You like my ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall misses the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than your pool game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper lines up his shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't want to put a small  wager on this, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't gamble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper smiles. Sinks his shot. Moves around the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've got a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You living together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's back in Jersey... going to  graduate school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain how that works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to come here when she  graduates and then we're gonna get  married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grow up in Livingtston, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if that were  unthinkable) No, no, no... (a beat) She's from Hoboken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, "city girl". Don't you ever long  for companionship with her such a  long way away in New Jersey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see each other every couple of  months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every couple of months, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of months sounds like an awful long time to Rope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot of commitment. I admire  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Actually I think it's fucking  crazy, I don't know if I could do  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for clearing that up. (a beat) I hear your former girlfriend is  going out with Greg Barnett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around. Barnett's tough competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well that's a sore subject,  and therefore out of bounds to a  young sprout of a hostage negotiator  under my tutelage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat and then McCall realizes that this comment is a ma acknowledgement of acceptance from Roper. Roper misses hi shot. Picks up his beer glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lesson two, "Dead Eye"... should  have been lesson one. Never exchange  yourself for a hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can handle that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you think so, but it comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper takes a drink of beer. Nears the bottom of his glas Calls to the BARTENDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack, another round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper turns back to McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My partner gave himself in exchange  for a ten year old girl. He got caught  in the crossfire. Two dead. My partner  and the bad guy... (takes the last sip) Weird thing is, if he was alive,  he'd probably do it again. (a beat) Some people never learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper puts down his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can learn, McCall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper nods. Maybe he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at a door. It's not clear where we are. McC enters. We only see his face. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Officer McCall, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a training room. It's built to approximate a conveni store. Several mannequins are placed around the room to  represent a hostage situation. The "BAD GUY" has a walkie talkie strapped around his neck. Roper's voice CRACKLES o of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you think is going  on, turdhead? I'm about to waste  everyone in this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall hesitates, trying to figure out a response. He see stiff and awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H... how can I help you? Tell me  what... (looks off to his  right) I feel stupid talking to a dummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper enters the training room from a side door. He's hol the other walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think? I'm going to let  you practice on real people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper comes up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things is, don't say, "What's  going on?" Everybody knows what's  going on. I come into this situation,  I say, (addressing the  mannequin) "I'm glad to see nobody's hurt. That's  good. I'm here to help you." (turns back to McCall) Second: You hesitated. Don't hesitate.  If you're thinking, talk while you're  thinking, or else he's going to think  you're plotting. Which you are. If  he thinks you're plotting, you're  going to make him nervous. You don't  want him nervous. Got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll come. Try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE DOOR. McCall comes in. The room has the same set-up. McCall takes a look around. Launches immediately  into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's McCall. I'm a hostage  negotiator. I'm here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper's voice crackles back at him hostilely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you going to help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall's confidence is growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to bring me the scumbag  who ran off with my wife so I can  cut off his nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he's stumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get out of my face you worthless  piece of frogshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall looks up to his right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is all the name calling necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper re-enters the training area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I just throw that in because I  enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) So what do I say to this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could say something like, (addressing the dummy) "Tell me what the scumbag's name is.  Maybe we can work something out."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Bring somebody in so he can  cut his nuts off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper turns to McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to be a successful  negotiator, you've got to learn to  lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not good at lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's against my nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper gives him an amused smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the ten commandments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the first commandment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thou shall have no other God before  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the answer Roper wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, forget that. What's the main  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall is tired of guessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thou shall not kill... You've killed,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why would you hesitate to lie to  save lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall can't argue with that one. Roper turns and heads b to the side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall comes through the door. Hands in the air. The setu in the room has been changed a bit. The bad guy is behind the counter. Several hostages in various positions on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's McCall. I'm unarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper comes through the side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall is surprised by the command but closes them. Roper turns him away from the hostage scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapid-fire) A dirtbag behind the counter holding  a sawed-off. A Berretta nine  millimeter in his belt. A female  hostage, red dress, on the floor in  front of the cereal display.
