Male  hostage, jeans and blue checked shirt,  three feet to her right. Another  male hostage, white pants, green  shirt, Nikes, laying in front of the  magazine rack. A female dirtbag with  a gun under her shirt, sitting against  the beer cooler, trying to pass  herself off as a hostage, and there's  a special on toilet-paper, four for  a buck twenty-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall opens his eyes. Roper's impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. You've got good eyes.  That's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall are sitting in the dark watching a video tape. It's grainy footage of a hostage situation in a spo goods store. A negotiator confronted with a gunman holdin ten year old girl hostage. The negotiator holds his hands out imploringly... Carefully moves toward the gunman. The negotiator exchanges himself for the little girl. The gun grabs the negotiator around the neck, holds the gun to hi head. The little girl runs out of the picture to safety. Roper remains dead silent during all this. McCall looks o at him. The blue light flickers over Roper's motionless f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that your partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Because he knew the little girl had  zero chance of survival and his  chances would be a little better...  We had a plan, but SWAT opened up  too early. He got caught in the  crossfire. (a sad beat) Let's move on... Notice this. Always  use the eyes to keep the connection.  It almost like hypnosis. That's the  most important thing. Create a  connection. You're always on their  side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall watches him for a beat, then turns his attention b on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful day. Roper and McCall leaning against the rail the walking ring. The horses are being paraded and saddle Roper scrutinizes them with an expert eye. McCall seems  totally disinterested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I like the track?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a compulsive gambler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper ignores that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because there are a multitude of  possibility's. Everything is there  to see if you know what to look for.  You have to read the conditions,  just like in a hostage situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper points across the ring to a particular horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the four horse. Dropping in class.  No works. Front wraps. Looks like  he's broken down. But notice the  woman in the sun hat. She's the owner.  She wouldn't have come if her horse  was broken down. He's live. We use  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall listens indifferently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the favorite? Tail up. Washy. He  doesn't want to run today. Cross him  off... Now the Six looks good. On  his toes. Coat shiny. This  trainer/jockey combo does well. We  can't leave him out. (turns to McCall) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have two words for you... Seek  help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have three words for you... Ex-ac- ta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper is buying tickets. McCall is with him, watching the other bettors, the odds board, all the monitors... Strang place. Roper finishes and turns away from the window. Han McCall a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought you a four-six exacta box.  You owe me twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall pass by a gambler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin', Marv?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit down in a box right up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need the 4 and 6 to finish to  first and second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no enthusiasm) Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper uses his binoculars to watch the horses warm up on backstretch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm told that newspaper photographer  is your former girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper looks over at him. What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie... Yeah, so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's going out with Greg Barnett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want?... An autograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why she'd pick him over  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper throws McCall a skeptical look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straight-faced) I'm just practicing my lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still needs work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (downcast) You're right. I'll never be as good  a liar as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're racing!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRACK
dialogues.text: The horses spring from the gate. (The track announcer's c plays through race)

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: Roper watches intently through the binoculars. McCall sit impassively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're in good shape. We're in  good shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall looks across the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 6 horse is last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. That's his style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To run last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To run late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper follows the horses into the turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The favorite's fading. I told you he  wasn't going to run today... The  four horse has got the lead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall sits like a wax figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cynically) The 6 horse is still last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be running at the quarter pole.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRACK
dialogues.text: The horses head into the stretch. The FOUR is on the lead and the SIX is starting to unleash a big run. Passing hor with every stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he goes.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: McCall sits forward slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They need to run first and second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, first and second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRACK
dialogues.text: The horses thunder down the stretch. The FOUR horse is in front and the SIX is coming on from behind.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: Roper is on his feet screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Russell! Come on, Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall jumps to this feet and joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COME ON RUSSELL!... (to Roper) Who the fuck's Russell?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jockey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COME ON, RUSSELL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall cheer together.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRACK
dialogues.text: The FOUR horse crosses the finish line in front. The SIX  horse is flying... Needs to beat one horse to be second.. He's running out of room... With one last surge he hits t wire and... It's too close to call.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: McCall, really excited, turns to Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disheartened) We lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidently) We won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to bet on whether you won  your bet? This is getting sick.

dialogues.speaker: TOTE BOARD
dialogues.text: As the photo finish light goes out and the numbers come o 4-6-8. They won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High fives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's eight hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall collect their money. Four hundred a piec not bad. McCall pockets his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been coming here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About six years. My partner took me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it always like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Occasionally you lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Roper's BEEPER goes off. He checks it, takes out cellular phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Roper here. (he listens) I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and turns to McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marble facade. Tastefully reinforced windows and door.  Choppers circle overhead. Both ends of the street are sea off. Barricades are up. Spectators and news crews crowd b those. Numerous police circulate. This is a major operati in full swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's across the street from the jewelry store. Second sto The walls are plastered with travel posters. A poster of  Tahiti is the most prominent. Members of police and SWAT standing over a blueprint of the jewelry store spread out a table. Right behind them is a TV monitoring the front o the store. Solis is at another desk, on the phone. He's  talking to the suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're working on that, Joe. These  things aren't quite that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall push through the barricades and come wal down the cordoned-off street. McCall takes a look at the  jewelry store. Well fortified, foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This does not look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper looks over there, gives no reaction. They reach Sol convertible Cadillac. It's parked out front of the travel agency building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this. Solis has me driving the  shit-mobile, and he picked this up  straight out of impound for fourteen  grand. Probably worth thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police corruption. It's everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall enter. McCall joins the men who are stud the blueprint. Roper stands by Solis and listens, takes n of the poster of Tahiti. Looks inviting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will take time to setup. I'll  have to get authorizations. (he listens) Okay, you relax, and I'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solis pulls the phone away from his ear. Joe has obviousl hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 minutes ago the silent alarm went  off, then the fire alarm. A unit was  a block away, and the suspect got  trapped inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any verification on numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only seen and talked to one  suspect. He calls himself "Joe".  There's two jewelers, two salespeople,  the manager, a security guard, and  an elderly woman. This particular  store is where they do a lot of  jewelry making and repair. They have  anywhere from 8 to 10 million in raw  stones on any given day, so they  sure as shit didn't just wander in.  They knew what they were coming for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you promised them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that I'd talk to my superiors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall returns from checking out the blueprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any good points of entry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is designed to be a vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper picks up the cellular phone. It dials automatically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) My name's Roper. How are you people  doing in there? (he listens) Solis is off the job now, Joe. I'm  the guy authorized to give you  whatever you want. (listens) That's right, but first I need to  come down there to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't see anything but the suspect on the other end of the phone. He's wearing a ski mask and gloves. Totally  unrecognizable to the audience. We will find out soon tha he is, in fact, Korda. He appears very cool and collected

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. That way there's no  misunderstandings. I need to make  sure no one's hurt, then we can take  care of business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause... Then a bit sinister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Roper. You want to come...  come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I won't be armed. We gotta  operate on trust here. We're going  to wrap this up and have you guys  out of here as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper clicks off the phone. He already doesn't like the s of this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper, bulletproof vest, hands in the air, walks across t eerily deserted street straight toward the jewelry store. It's quiet now. The choppers have been pulled back. Roper reaches the sidewalk right in front of the store. K cracks the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warningly) Stay there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to put my hands down, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper slowly lowers his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody watching through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda takes a half step out the doorway. The gloved hand  that is visible is not holding a weapon. The other half o his body is hidden inside the doorway. He wears jeans, a  black shirt, and black Nike tennis shoes. He stares fierc from behind the ski mask. There's no sign of fear in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in charge, Roper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a car. Like a four wheel drive.  I want it in perfect condition. I  want a uniformed cop to drive it up  right here. I want him to leave the  engine running and walk to the end  of the street. Then we'll come out.  I don't want any remote control  devices in it. I know all the tricks.  If it's not in perfect condition,  and I mean if its even low on wiper  fluid, I'm going to kill somebody  and we're gonna start again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda lets that sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a plane waiting at the airport.  I'll tell them where I want to go  when I get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get it. But, Joe, I want you  to do something for me. Let me take  a look around inside. Make sure  everybody's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You just do shit for me right  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda's eyes glare from behind the ski mask. He's an omin figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, I'm doing a lot for you. I think  you could give me something to cement  the deal... One hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda pulls a wadded-up handkerchief out of his pocket an tosses it to Roper. Roper unwraps the handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a human ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fifteen minutes it'll be a bigger  piece. I assume there are no  "misunderstanding".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper is as serious as we've ever seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda disappears back behind the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper trudges back in. Things are more active now. Logist officers are making flow charts. Photos of the hostages a being posted on a bulletin board. Roper approaches Solis, McCall and the SWAT CAPTAIN who are anxiously waiting for his report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) We're going to have to take this guy  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That draws a long silence. That's something Roper rarely  says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we wear him down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper hands Solis the handkerchief with the ear in it. So eyes it with dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe there's at least one  fatality in there already. The fire  alarm was probably set off by gunfire.  I believe he's working alone, both  from his conversation and the fact  that he wouldn't come out beyond the  doorway. He was holding a gun on the  hostages while he was talking to me.  His demeanor is calm and controlled,  that's what really scares me. The  other bad news is that he also  indicated a familiarity with our  techniques. (a beat) So, do you want to go in or wait for  him to come out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall calmly offers his opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him come out. Too many unknowns  in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solis nods. That'll be the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we drive up the car, make sure  it's at an angle about three feet  from the curb. (to SWAT Captain) Put our best man "highground", Twenty  degree down angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT Captain motions and turns to one of his UNDERLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have Anderson prep it and notify us  when he's on line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The underling hurries off to take care of it. Solis looks Roper dejectedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel this thing going sideways on  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper tries to buck him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is some good news. He's wearing  a ski mask, so he's protecting his  identity and hasn't determined to  kill all the hostages... (big pause) Yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jewel thief pulls off his ski mask to reveal he is Ko His face is sweaty. Hair matted. ANGLE WIDENS to show fiv very scared hostages: A JEWELER, middle-aged, balding. Th male MANAGER, good-looking, thirties, three piece suit. T SALESGIRLS, nicely dressed, late twenties. A FEMALE CUSTO gray-haired Hillsborough matron. They are all seated agai the wall. There are two fatalities lying on the floor. Th guard and one of the jewelers. Korda points his gun at the manager and the other jeweler and motions to the dead bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drag them behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men reluctantly get to their feet and commence th grim task. The two salesgirls watch Korda fearfully. The  older female customer seems to be in a lesser state of  reality. Her eyes are a bit far away. Korda moves over to the remaining display cases that have been looted. With the barrel of his gun, He SMASHES the g reaches in and picks out the jewelry. He dumps it in an o satchel already half-filled with packets of raw gemstones and gold chains. Suddenly, the older woman customer gets her feet. She seems fairly out-of-it. Maybe in shock. She starts walking toward the front door frowning with  dissatisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not staying here another minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicky) No, Mrs. Dotson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda rushes around the display case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, hag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a handful of the woman's coiffed gray hair and d her away from the door. She shrieks. The manager takes a  step toward Korda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda pistol whips her across the forehead and drops her  unconscious to the floor then turns the gun on the manage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a brave one, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager glares at him. He's about Korda's size. He th about making a run at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) Sit down, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat... The manager sits back down on the floor wi the other hostages. Salesgirl 1 is giving aid to the old  woman. Korda looks down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's not conscious when it's  time to leave, I'll have to kill  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda goes back to the display cases to collect the rest the gems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops clear spectators out of the way as a green FORD EXPL RUMBLES through the barricade and heads down the deserted street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall at the window, attention fixed on the st The Explorer crawls to a stop in front of the jewelry sto Parks at a slight angle. The uniformed police officer get out, leaving the engine running, and walks off back to th barricade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Time to give this fucker a  call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper picks up the phone, waits. Everybody tensely watchi the store.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sniper team watching the store from a third floor windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper holding the phone. It's still ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another sharpshooting team. Poised. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And still another sharpshooter team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is still ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fucker's not answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, the front door of the jewelry store swings ope A spray of white vapor shoots out the doorway. Korda is  discharging a fire extinguisher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your answer. He's smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cutting down the visibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And doing a very good job of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick cloud of white hangs over the sidewalk obscuring front of the jewelry store. Roper puts down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Give us one clean shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his radio) All positions, you have the green  light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper grabs a pair of binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the haze, we catch glimpses of the hostages circl around the figure in the ski mask. They slowly shuffle to the Explorer. McCall watches intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sniper watches through his scope. Finger poised on the  trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low visibility through the haze. The figure in the ski ma wavers in and out of the crosshairs, shielded momentarily the jeweler, then he flashes back into the crosshairs. Th sniper tries to lock him in.

dialogues.speaker: BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: The figure in the ski mask leans slightly and Roper catch a glimpse of the hostage right behind him. Roper recogniz him instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Korda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall sees him now, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They switched clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper drops the binoculars and grabs his police radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently) Hold your fire! Hold your fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. A SHOT rings out. The figure in the ski mask go down, hit by the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Where'd that shot come from?  Hold your fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More SHOTS ring out.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The white vapor cloud swirls. The hostages, spattered wit blood, scream and scatter. The figure in the ski mask lie dead on the sidewalk. Korda, dressed in the manager's thr piece suit, holding the satchel of jewels in one hand and his gun in the other FIRES back at the snipers. He grabs  salesgirl 1 and drags her into the Explorer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper sees Korda move toward the car with one of the host

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Roper turns into the room he notices a set of keys on  Solis' desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing the keys;  to Solis) Are these yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they are but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to McCall) Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Roper and McCall move toward the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper, what are you going to do?  Don't take my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Roper and McCall are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...car.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Police come rushing onto the street. Guns drawn. The Expl ROARS off down the block. Roper and McCall burst out of t command center building, leap into Solis' Cadillac and te off after the van. McCall is behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Explorer comes barreling toward it. Spectators scatte Two squad cars SCREECH up behind the barricades, trying t block Korda's escape. The Explorer PLOWS through the meta barricades. BASHES the squad cars out of the way. And scr off around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Explorer careens up an alley and bursts into the cong traffic of a side street. HONK-SCREECH! A Toyota swerves miss it and broadsides a parked car. The Explorer fishtai off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesgirl is terrified. Korda checks the rear view mi No one on his tail... At first. Then the Cadillac comes  speeding up behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall have the Van in sight, about a block ahe Roper picks up the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suspect heading west on Sutter now  passing Jones. Can we get an  intercept?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R-32-David. We are proceeding south  on Hyde. Will intercept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda has one eye on the road and the other on the rear v mirror. The Cadillac is making up ground.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: a squad car SCREECHES into the intersection and smokes to stop. Korda jerks the wheel, pulls a SCREAMING right turn and heads up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac is only about a hundred feet behind the van. Brakes SQUEALING, it swerves around the corner in pursuit

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: hits the top of the hill and goes airborne... SLAMS back  down to the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda floors it, and we get a frightening view out the  windshield as they head straight downhill. The salesgirl beyond petrified.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: reaches the top of the hill. Going fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it rocks forward violently. Front bumper slamming agai the pavement. McCall sees the van ahead. Hammers the  accelerator. No fear.

dialogues.speaker: VAN
dialogues.text: Korda sees traffic ahead... Intersection jammed. He pulls hard left.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: cuts straight across the corner... up on the sidewalk...  shears a mailbox... a row of newspaper machines fly throu the air... The van speeds off down a one-way street...

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: arrives at the intersection a few seconds later...  Intersection still jammed... People now standing on the c gawking at the damage. The Caddy SCREECHES to a stop. McC HONKS... The people scatter... The Cadillac drives throug the corner.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: Wrong way down a one-way street. Cars coming right at us every angle. Frantic HONKING. Salesgirl SHRIEKS. Tires  SMOKING... No way to avoid collision... Except Korda pull left an instant before impact... The van speeds back up t hill.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILIAC
dialogues.text: Down the same one way street... Comes up on the head-on  traffic, now stopped, paralyzed with fear from the near  collision with Korda...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac roars around the corner and heads up the hil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda, checking the rear view mirror. The Caddy is a shor distance behind. Attention still focused behind, Korda en an intersection, running a red light... CROSS-TRAFFIC...  Korda stiffens... Pulls on the wheel

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: The van swerves... But not quick enough... GRINDING metal SHATTERING glass... The van rolls over another car...

dialogues.speaker: BRIEF CUT
dialogues.text: Korda and the salesgirl tossed about as the van does a  dizzying roll...

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: ...and CRASHES back down to the street upside down. After beat, Korda crawls from the wreckage carrying the satchel jewels. The salesgirl does not emerge. He spots a cable c reaching the top of the hill and starting its long descen He heads toward it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Korda comes toward them from the wreckage, some of the passengers view him uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: hits the top of the hill just in time for Rope and McCall see Korda leap onto the moving cable car.

dialogues.speaker: CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: other passengers give Korda room. They can sense that he not here merely for the ride. Korda looks out the back... Roper and McCall haven't lost track of him. The Cadillac making up ground on the cable car. Korda moves to the back exit, pulls his gun and FIRES off couple of shots at the Caddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bullet fractures the windshield. McCall swerves.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: That makes up the minds of many of the passenger. They le off the cable car. Korda takes aim on the Caddy again and FIRES! The brakeman charges down the aisle while Korda has his  attention focused out the back and tries to shove him off the cable car... Almost works... but Korda is able to hang on by one hand. He swings around toward the Brakeman who turns involuntar as he sees the barrel of the gun pointed at him... BANG!  Korda shoots him in the back. The brakeman staggers down the aisle and slumps across th brake lever, releasing it more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brakes are stressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now driverless, the cable car picks up speed... Broadside car... Pushing it into parked cars...

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Korda and the remaining passengers are rocked around.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: THUNDERS towards us... Filling the FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shows the cable car leaving the wreckage in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: CADILLAC
dialogues.text: It passes the smashed car. McCall looks at the speedomete as he paces the cable car. It's going at 45 mph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I've got to get on  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable car barrels through... Plows into two cross-tra cars... Knocks them aside... Keeps picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Weaves through the wreckage... Makes up ground on the cab car, trying to pull alongside.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: For the moment, Korda is not shooting at the Caddy. His  attention is now focused downhill as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable car nails another vehicle sending it spinning o to the side.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADDY
dialogues.text: dodges the spinning car... Jumps up onto the sidewalk...  Mows down parking meters... Jumps back onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Korda leans out the door, takes aim at the Caddy... Anoth jammed intersection up ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the cable car coming in his rear view mirror. He  bails out...

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: SLAMS into the back of the car. Major impact.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Korda and the passengers are thrown to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE REAR-ENDED CAR
dialogues.text: Tumbles down the hill... Hits a car coming uphill and rol into a parked car.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Speeds up alongside the cable car. Roper climbs over the  windshield, onto the hood and leaps onto the cable car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda sees him coming. FIRES. Roper dives out the other s of the cable car.

dialogues.speaker: CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Roper hanging off the side. He gets his gun out of his  holster... Up ahead, a car pulls away from the curb... Roper swings around to get back into the relative safety the cable car. As he does his gun is raked out of his han by the car which avoids a collision by a millimeter.

dialogues.speaker: CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Korda aims as Roper re-enters...

dialogues.speaker: CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: As it CRASHES into the back of a car turning left. Everyone is thrown toward the front of the car. Korda's g goes flying. Roper dives on top of him. They trade punche McCall is in b.g. with the Caddy pacing the cable car.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: Pedestrains bolt out of the way as the cable car streaks  through...

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Roper hammers Korda into unconsciousness. Outside McCall honking and yelling like crazy. Roper looks over... McCal points ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable car.

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Leaps to the brake lever. Pulls on it.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: The clamp tries to slow the descent. It whine and smokes. Then disintegrates before our eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Roper feels the lever go slack in his hands. The cable ca is speeding toward the end of the line... No way to stop  it... Roper turns and takes a running leap into the Caddy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lands in the passenger seat. Roper pounds his foot dow on the accelerator. The Caddy lunges ahead of the cable c McCall can't figure out what he's doing. Roper yanks the  steering wheel hard right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy collides with the front of the cable car. Tires SCREAM. The steel wheels CLATTER. A cloud of burning rubb forms. The cable car grinds forward pushing the Cadillac. But it's working. The cable car is slowing.

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOM OF STREET
dialogues.text: The crowd now sees the Caddy and cable car bearing down o them. General hysteria as they flee.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Korda regains consciousness. Sees what's going on. He gra the satchel and bails out of the cable car...

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: ...Onto the hood of a passing taxi. The taxi slams on its brakes. Korda rolls off the hood, picks himself up and ru into an underground garage.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE CAR
dialogues.text: Grinding to a halt just short of the end of the line. Rop grabs McCall's gun off the seat and leaps out of the Cadd to pursue Korda. People approach to ogle the two vehicles astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper moves up an interior stairway, gun in "ready" posit He knows Korda is somewhere in the parking structure. He  glides up the stairway to the third level. Checks back ov the rail... No one around... Then a sound from inside the garage... Footsteps maybe. Roper carefully opens the door... Swings in with his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of cars, but no one in sight. Roper moves quickly to the protection of a row of cars... He crouches down. Scan beneath the cars... No sign of Korda. Roper searches between two rows... Comes up beside a van. Thinks he hears something stirring inside. Whirls a gun t the window. A dog lunges at the CAMERA... Snarling... baring teeth... Roper moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a BMW crawls through the parking structure. Roper step into the FOREGROUND, right into its path, gun visible. Th BMW rolls to a stop. Roper approaches with caution. Roper comes up beside the car and sees a very frightened year old blonde. Roper takes a check out of the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, go.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: The woman rolls up the window and hits the gas. She drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper stands in the middle of the garage and takes a fina scan... He has the discouraging feeling that Korda might  have escaped. He heads toward the exit... Suddenly a SCREECH of tires.. Roper whirls to see a sedan bearing down on him. He drive and FIRES! Bullets shatter the windshield. The car continues toward Roper. He has to roll out of the path of the car. The car swerves past Roper. Tries to mak it down the ramp. Roper fires again, taking out the rear  window and a rear tire. The car slides along the guard ra and continues down to the next level. Roper runs after it

dialogues.speaker: GARAGE
dialogues.text: As the car reaches the next level, Korda loses control an piles into a parked car. Korda crawls out of the car clutching his precious satche of jewels. Dazed, he staggers away from the wreck. Roper moves to him with a face grim as death. He strips t satchel from Korda's hand and slams him against the open door. Korda goes to his knees. Roper holds the barrel of gun right up between Korda's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me one reason why I shouldn't  kill you right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda stares back at Roper defiantly. He knows a cop won' kill him in cold blood... What he doesn't know is that Roper doesn't give a shit ab those rules at this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Sam Baffert was a friend of  mine. He had a wife... and he had a  daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda stares past the barrel of the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit about you or  your fucking friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that makes Roper even angrier... But he keeps it all  inside. His expression is as cold as a San Francisco nigh He yanks back hard on Korda's hair. Pushes the gun tighte against Korda's forehead. He's on the verge of executing  this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill me like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you and me got into a  struggle... and my gun went off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash, Roper points the gun upward and fires off a S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I kill you then? (beat, beat) Could I kill you then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper jams the gun back under Korda's chin. A pull of the trigger would send a bullet straight up through Korda's s And now Korda is fully convinced. He squeezes his eyes cl Face straining so hard, he looks like he's going to burst out of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: moving across garage into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper! Put it down!... Put it down  man, we got him. (beat) Come on... Put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long, long beat. Roper eases up and Korda smiles. Just wh we feel the scene is over, Roper turns back quickly and k Korda in the stomach, then grabs Korda by the hair, pulls his head back and shoves the gun in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do this shit by the book, but you  ain't gonna be smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda is doubled up coughing, spitting up blood. Roper wa away as McCall moves in to put the cuffs on Korda.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper is sitting in a cubicle doing paperwork. A group of reporters and photographers move down the hallway adjoini the squadroom. One of them is Ronnie. Through the glass w she notices Roper sitting alone at the computer. She bids good-night to the reporters and comes into the squadroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't at the press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper keeps tapping away at the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to get this out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a bet on the game tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to catch the last half  on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie watches him for a moment. He stops typing, looks a her and smiles. She suddenly becomes self-conscious. Gues it was something she was thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns abruptly to leave. Roper finds himself rising f his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You having dinner with Mr. Baseball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg is on a road trip. I was just  going to make some pasta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a few steps toward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kind with the garlic and the  oil that I like so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The kind from Kraft, with the  macaroni and the cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been craving that stuff all  week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's hard to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just dinner.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is making macaroni. Roper helps to prepare a dress to go with the salad. He is mixing oil, vinegar, sugar an spices. He lets her have a taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, needs a little something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? This is  it. This is the stuff right here. (beat; he tastes) Well, maybe just a pinch more sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just stick your finger  in and stir it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Scottie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause as he looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say if I quit gambling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie stirs the macaroni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say you'd be miserable... It's  not the gambling. It's what the  gambling got in the way of. The track  is where you'd take your troubles  instead of sharing them with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie puts the lid on the macaroni. There is a beat befo she continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, remember the day you lost  that hostage in union square. You  came over that night and we made  mad, crazy love. But I didn't even  know what happened... 'til I heard  it on the news the next morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because I wanted to keep you  away from that world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that world. It's your world.  It's part of who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Veronica, it's not easy for me... I  don't know if I can change overnight.  But what I'm telling you is that I  want to share everything with you,  because I don't ever want to be  without you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog yawns. They laugh. Roper moves closer to her. He  kisses her and she responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lovemaking is over. Roper is gazing at the ceiling,  thinking. Ronnie is cuddled around him. A comfortable  moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Greg? What are you gonna  tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. We broke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence Teal, Korda's cousin sits in front of the plexig wall. He's edgy, fidgety. Clarence doesn't like to make v to jail. Korda, wearing prison clothes, is led in by a guard. Kord takes a seat at the other side of the plexiglass wall and picks up the receiver. Clarence picks up his receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin', man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda grips the phone, leans forward and stares through t wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta do something for me...  this fucker, Roper, he's gotta  girlfriend. She works at the  newspaper. I want you to take care  of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence is totally unnerved by this request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Michael, that's not my thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda glares at him murderously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta do this for me. I'm in  here because of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, what's this about? Ya know, you  were robbing a store. It wasn't  personal. It was his job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Fuck you! You know what he did to  me?!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda starts to draw the attention of the guard. He contr himself, lowers his voice. But the viciousness is still t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He held a gun to my head and said he  should kill me right then... He made  me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't finish that thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do this for me Clarence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence is getting very upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make do it, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to turn on me too? Who  helped you when you were strung out?  Who gave you money? Who bailed you  out of jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows who you are. Make it  look like a robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence holds back tears, because he knows he's going to have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gray San Francisco evening. It starts to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cooking some kind of sauce. She has a taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A subjective POV watching through the window as she moves around the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie pours some oil in a pan. The phone RINGS. She cros the kitchen to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper on his cell phone. Paco is on the seat beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm going to stop at the corner  for some wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper notices the rain, searches for the windshield wiper switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Paco doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was going nuts at the park. He  met this very attractive poodle.  They made plans to meet again next  weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paco sits there panting. Roper pulls the pickup over in f of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, dinner will be ready when you  get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window we watch her cross back to the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie lifts the lid on the sauce. Stirs. It spatters on blouse. She regards the stain with dismay. Puts the lid b on and leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie unbuttons her blouse as she moves to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off the blouse, goes to the closet door... thro it open. She looks around. Something's not right. She tak a step into the closet and finds what she's looking for - laundry basket -- tucked away in the corner. She puts the soiled blouse in the hamper and takes a fresh one off a  hanger. She buttons the clean blouse as she walks to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. She turns on the light. She goes to the mirrored  medicine cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE REFLECTION
dialogues.text: Behind her the shower curtain is drawn, fluttering ever s slightly. She opens the medicine cabinet. Takes out some  perfume. Dabs some on her neck. She puts back the bottle closes the cabinet. We fully expect someone to be standin right behind her in the reflection... There's no one ther She turns off the light as she walks out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie walks back to the kitchen... Notices something on floor further down the hallway... What is it? She moves  closer... And now we get to the POV that tells us someone in the house... Watching her through a cracked doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BRIEF CUT
dialogues.text: A hand opening a buck knife. Water drips from the fingers

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE HALL
dialogues.text: Ronnie bends down. It's a wet spot. Like half a shoeprint She reaches down to touch it... BUZZZZZ!!!! The oven timer. She hurries back to the kitch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns off the timer and pulls some chicken out of the oven. She puts it down on the counter and cross to the  refrigerator. She opens the door and looks inside. The  refrigerator door obscures half the FRAME... She digs aro for something... We're sure that when she closes the door he's going to be behind it... She takes out a head of let and... Closes the door... Still no one there. She turns... Clarence is standing there. Dripping wet. Ro shrieks... The knife flashes forward... She grabs the lid from the sauce pan and CLANG... Fends off the blade. She  bolts for the hallway. Clarence grabs her by the blouse.. RIP! She pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: She races down the hall. Clarence lunges into FRAME. She  goes down... He goes down... the knife goes skidding down the hallway... Ronnie scrambles to get it... Clarence has her by the ankle... She claws for the knife... Just out o reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper's pickup pulls up in front. He gets out. Paco jumps out behind him. It's raining harder. They hurry up the wa toward the house. Suddenly Roper realizes he forgot the w He goes back to the truck. Paco pads after him. Roper opens the driver's side door, reaches in and grabs wine. He closes the door, starts away, but pauses to chec himself in the window. Suddenly, a floodlight comes crashing through Ronnie's fr bay windows. It SPARKS and FLASHES. Still plugged in, it  bungees to a stop hallway down the front of the house.  FLICKERING and FLASHING. Roper rushes toward the house... Crashes through the fron door... Up the stairway... Paco bounds after him... Roper hits her front door running... Wham! He bounces off. He  shoulders it again... The door doesn't give... He pulls o his gun... BAM! BAM! Shoots off the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A QUICK SHOT of Clarence's hand grabbing the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper kicks open the door. Charges in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is laying on the floor, gasping for air. Choke mar around her throat. Roper rushes to her side. Paco is on h heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Points out the back way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paco) Stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog obediently stays with Ronnie. Roper dashes out th back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining more heavily now. Roper bursts out onto the back  porch. Sees Clarence leaping off the last rung of the fir escape to the alley. Roper flies down the fire escape...  Vaults the last flight and races after Clarence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence sprints down the block... Through the intersecti HONK! SCREECH! A car barely misses him. It does a one-eig on the rain-slick pavement. Clarence disappears into the  shadows. Roper arrives a beat later... Streaks through th intersection... Into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is steep. Clarence huffs and puffs as he labors. shoots into a doorway. Tries the door. Locked. He looks b Roper is coming. Relentless. He rushes across the steep  street. Almost slips on the reflective asphalt. Roper spo him crossing and picks up the pace. He can see that Clare is faltering.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE TOP OF THE HILL
dialogues.text: Clarence staggers into an alleyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narrow, dark and dripping with rain. Roper arrives at the mouth of the alley. Gun ready, he moves cautiously, eyes  adjusting to the darkness. The PATTER of rain off the  rooftops. His FOOTSTEPS. No other sound. He reaches the end of the alley... A brick wall. No way o Or so it would seem. However, Clarence is nowhere in sigh Roper turns back. Brick walls tower on both sides, rising into darkness. Roper checks a steel door. Locked. He chec another one on the opposite side of the alley. Also locke Where did Clarence go? He moves back toward the misting l of the street... Slowly... The FAINT RATTLE of a fire escape... And Clarence leaps d out of the shadow. Slashing with the knife. He catches Ro across the arm. Rips through his clothes right down to the skin. Roper's CLATTERS under a parked car and into the street. Clarence has first jump. He scrambles into the street, around the and grabs the gun... Roper dives over the hood of the car and knocks Clarence  down before he can aim. They roll into the middle of the  street. Both have a death grip on the weapon. Clarence fi like a trapped animal. Thrashing desperately. Roper pins on his back, but can't pry the gun out of his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights radiate over the crest of the hill. Coming qui Roper sees this. He rolls out of the way, abandoning the  battle for the gun. Clarence struggles to his knees. Turn the weapon on Roper... A speeding cab lunges over the top the hill. Clarence turns, trapped in the searing headligh Tires squeal. Brakes lock. Clarence is transfixed... WHAM He's launched through the air like a ragdoll... His body  lands limply 30 feet down the street. The CABBY gets out his vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. What was he doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper walks down the hill to the body. The cabby follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no way I could miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper ignores the cabby. He looks down at Clarence's body contemplating something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabby immediately clams up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on your radio and get the police  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper stares at Clarence's body, steel-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda is led in again. An expression of surprise register on his face when he sees who's waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper is sitting stoically behind the plexiglass wall.

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: Dons a smug expression and takes a seat. He picks up his  receiver as Roper picks up his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you try again to hurt me or anyone  I know, I'm going to have you killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda feigns total innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the world are you talking  about, Mr. Roper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper takes out a photograph and holds it up against the  glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a picture of your cousin  Clarence. That gentleman standing  over him is the coroner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda's face tightens. He drops the innocent act. His  countenance is now a study in hate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to have an apartment, a car,  jewelry. I had a fucking eight  thousand dollar watch. Now look what  I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're threatening me? You think I  give a fuck? You think you can scare  me off? (a laugh) Why don't you come in here and kick  my ass? Get some of your guard friends  in here to help. I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper glares at him mounting rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smirking) He really shook you up, didn't he?...  I've got ten years worth of appeals  to figure out how to fuck with you.  Who knows? Maybe some scumbag lawyer  will get me out on a technicality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper sits there, suddenly feeling powerless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came here to threaten me? That's  a laugh. Maybe you should BEG me...  Go ahead. Get down on your knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper leaps from his chair and smashes the receiver again the plexiglass wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfucker, I swear I'll kill  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard rushes over and restrains Roper. Wrestles him a from the glass wall. Roper pushes him off and gathers him He gives Korda one last stare. Korda sits there smirking  back at him... Roper turns his back and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall is practicing his negotiating techniques in a mirr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite right. He adjusts his stance. This time puts a  little hand movement into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to help you. Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still not satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Solis pokes his head in the door, he's been looki for McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a situation at the V.A.  Hospital. The responding officer has  requested a negotiator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Roper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his way. Get over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VETERAN wearing green fatigue is dangling another WHEEL BOUND VET over the edge. Fourteen floors up. The two fron wheels are literally hanging out there in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rambling incoherently) I can't fight this technology. They  have microprocessors made in totally  sterile environments. I've seen those  places. Everyone is dressed in white.  It's like paper clothing, man. They're  not even human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vet 2 is struggling to stay in the chair and not be tippe into the street 150 feet below. He is, needless to say, v panicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, don't do this, bro. Pull me  in. We'll do a few laps in the park  and figure out some other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not getting through to his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help this, man. Do you have  any idea what those microchips look  like? How small they are when they  put them in your brain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leading to the roof. A COUPLE OF COPS and MEMBERS OF THE  HOSPITAL STAFF peek out at the vet as he continues to ran and rave. McCall arrives at the top of the stairs. OFFICE #4 sure looks happy to see him. McCall takes a peek out o the roof. He isn't happy about what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we got here, he was already  doing his balancing act. I was talking  to him, but it made him more agitated  so I backed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about a microchip in his  brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE answers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Adler. He likes to be called  Dave. The other guy is Walter  Sinclair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the urgent cry of the vet in the wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody help me out here. Somebody  stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse turns to McCall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another negotiator is on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't wait for another negotiator.  You have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the doctors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hates all the doctors. He says  they're in on the conspiracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? He's going to  kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall takes a deep breath and steps out onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall moves slowly across the tar paper roof. Clouds ove threaten rain. Vet 1 turns to him suddenly, wobbling the  wheelchair. Vet 2 shrieks and nearly goes over. McCall's  heart jumps into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall is tense and stiff. He stammers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I'm Kevin. I 'm here to help  you, D... Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't help me, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for McCall's opener. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's high on something, man. Give  him some thorazine or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave ignores Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can help me. They're  controlling my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall moves a couple steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's controlling your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!... The government. They control  everybody's mind. You're too fucking  stupid to know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall fumbles for the right response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want Walter dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops keep spectators back from the building. Fire trucks rescue vehicles are on the scene. Everybody looking strai up watching the wheelchair with its occupant dangling ove the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits stock still in the wheelchair drenched with s eyes closed, praying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave obliges. He looks at McCall with eyes that have lost the battle for sanity. McCall is momentarily frozen by th eyes. Beads of sweat have formed on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Particles, man. I feel them all the  time. I feel them in my arms and  legs man, that's how they punish me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help you with the particles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just the particles man,  it's the whole fucking machine, this  is how they get assassins to operate.  It's been this way since the cuban  missile crisis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave starts to look over into the street, he tips Walter  forward, Walter shrieks in mortal fear. White knuckles th armrests of his wheelchair and then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting out) They have less power over you if you  look into my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall even surprises himself with that one. It was a she act of desperation. He holds his breath and waits to see  what the effect is. Dave turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper's truck comes speeding down the street, lurches to halt. He leaps out and speaks to a FIREMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whata ya got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some nuts dangling a guy over the  edge in a wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get a net out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. It's 14 floors up. No nets  gonna hold a fall from that high up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall nods slowly. Sweat pouring off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been onto them for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glimmer from Dave. Maybe McCall is a kindred spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he's got Dave's interest. McCall slowly takes out his beeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this. I'm jamming them, Dave.  I'm jamming their frequency so they  can't control your mind anymore.  Don't you feel that? You don't have  to do what they say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave listens to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's jamming them, Dave. Pull me  back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, the particles are gone,  they can't punish you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave tries to feel for particles. Tears form in Dave's ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him what, what do you want me  to tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell my dad I'm sorry about the watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell him. Where does he live.  We'll get him on the phone right  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is suddenly lost in thought again. His expression tu to a frown:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate fucking Springfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that where you're family lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then with sudden swiftness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still hear them, man. You can't  jam them. They've got the technology,  man. They've got the satellites,  Jack. They keep shooting beams off  those satellites. What power do I  have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave pushes the wheelchair forward. McCall LUNGES for the wheelchair but doesn't make it. Walter SCREAMS as he fall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: WALTER AND HIS WHEELCHAIR
dialogues.text: freefall down toward earth in SLOW MOTION. The wheelchair turns end over end. People SCREAM as Walter IMPACTS with pavement. The wheelchair CRASHES down nearby.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall looks over the edge at Walter's twisted body below Then he grabs Dave and wrestles him down, cuffing his han behind his back. The Cops and Medical Staff Members rush to restrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is dispersing. Roper is talking with some of th other cops. McCall storms out of the Vet Hospital and dow the stairs. Roper moves toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. McCall gets into his ND Sedan car and fires up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper races over and manages to jump in just as the car  screeches away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: BAY BRIDGE
dialogues.text: McCall doesn't even seem to have registered that Roper is the car with him. He drives. Stone-faced. Roper studies h for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving POV thru windshield of car, we see a freeway sign  that says "Golden Gate Racetrack."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish grand stands.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall pounds over to the betting window. Roper leans up  against the window beside him. Watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a twenty dollar four-six  exacta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six is scratched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This throws McCall for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me a fucking four-seven  exacta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teller punches out the ticket. McCall takes the ticke and pounds over to box seat area. Roper follows a couple steps behind, giving him some space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall sits down in the same box as the last time. Roper  sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses go into the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall watches intently as the horses spring from the gat (The track announcer's call plays over the scene.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on four horse! Come on Seven  horse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper isn't watching the horse. He's watching McCall. Wat him redirect all his pent up emotion. Understanding exact how he feels. McCall is screaming his head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on four-seven... Come on...  Come on... Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses cross the wire. The four and seven finish mid- pack. McCall hangs his head in despair. He didn't give a  shit about the race. He looks inconsolable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might have happened no matter who  was up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Would it have happened to  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... There's one thing you have  to remember... You don't create the  situations. You can only try to save  people from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I could do it. I was so  damn sure of myself. But I didn't  know what to say. The words wouldn't  come. My mouth turned to mush. You  make it look so easy, Roper. But it  is not. It's not easy. (beat) It's a different job than looking  through the rifle scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many have you lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look at it as how many I've saved.  That's the way you've got to look at  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about the ones you don't  save?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live with it... and they haunt  you. It doesn't leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if you can't live with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to decide that for  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall squeezes his eyes closed. He can still see that ve falling to his death. Roper can see McCall's pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lost three. One of them was my  partner. I think about them every  time I go into a situation. (a beat) There's a million people in this  city with all kinds of twisted shit  going on in their heads, and the  bitch of this job is that we expect  to go out every day and do the  impossible -- to somehow control all  this craziness... and we can't. (a beat) Nobody's faulting you for this,  McCall. My advice is you let yourself  off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall hears him but is still undecided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper gets up, stands over McCall, puts a hand on his  shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall slowly gets up and they walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small interview room. Korda sits opposite bail bon JOHN HAWKINS (white, grizzled, forty).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck... You bring me all  the way over here to tell me you've  got no collateral! What do I look  like to you -- Santa Claus? I'm a  bail bondsman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, see what I'm sayin' is, I've  got the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick up a fucking phone for chrissake!  You think I got time for this crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, I got shit on the outside.  I got somebody cashing it in for me  and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins gets up and goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a fuckin' break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, look, man, look,  just leave me your card. I can get  it to you by tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkins looks at him skeptically for a beat. Then pulls o his BUSINESS CARD and hands it to him. He walks out the d as we HOLD on Korda -- pocketing the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP of a glass of wine being poured. PULL BACK to re Roper and Ronnie all dressed up for a special evening. Th waiter hovers as Roper tastes the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snootily) It has a nice "nose".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The special this evening is braised  sweetbreads with a white truffle  sauce on cracked bulgar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper looks at him a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my favorite. (smiles) Why don't you give us a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter retreats. Roper looks across the table at Ronn as she sips her wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you realize that there's  something special that I want to  talk to you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't realize that. Now she's getting nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the last week things have been  going pretty well between us. I think  we've been doing a good job getting  intimate and all that stuff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's really worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Let me just show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper reaches into his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, we should think this over  before we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
