dialogues.text: He pulls out two airline tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tahiti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is immensely relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh... A vacation... Yeah that sounds  like a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper notices her relief and for the first time realizes  what she was thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you thought I was going to ask  you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie averts her eyes, a bit embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no-no-no-no-no... Let's go to  Tahiti first and see if that works  out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper picks up his menu and peruses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume you're having your usual --  the "air dried venison".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels of a laundry cart, moving slowly down the hall white metal door slides open, and the cart passes through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cart rolls into the room TILT UP to see

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: pushing the cart. He stops. A GUARD (guard #3) stands wit his back to Korda. He's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got another load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rack 'em up. (into the phone) Look, man, if it doesn't make it  down here by five it's not my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guard continues, Korda hangs several garment bags, zipped and tagged, onto an ELECTRIC TROLLEY -- similar to the kind used by dry-cleaners to move clothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda pushes a button and the trolley STARTS TO MOVE. The guard, still on the phone, buzzes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUARDS BACK
dialogues.text: We hear Korda wheeling the cart out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on the door sliding shut.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUARDS BACK
dialogues.text: Hold a beat. PANNING SLOWLY around the room to FIND -- su bag's moving on the trolley. BOOM DOWN to FIND Korda's fe just as they lift off the ground and disappear behind the bags.

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: hanging onto the trolley as it moves along the wall and t down through an opening in the floor and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it loops around a large room, carrying him toward the  back wall. The metal ridges of the trolley CUT into his  fingers, drawing blood. Then he drops down, and quietly  rummages through other bags of clothing. He tries on a pa of pants but they come up to his ankles. He looks like he about to go wading. As he rips them off and reaches for  another pair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda appears around a corner, dressed in street clothes, holding a CLIPBOARD -- moving steadily toward camera.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: A female civilian EMPLOYEE heading in his direction. As t pass he nods and she nods back. Then Korda passes through door at the end of the hallway and into...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes behind him and locks with the loud SNAP o metal. Slowly, with deliberate steps, he moves down the corridor toward the door at the other end, past the first GUARD (g #3) -- enclosed in bullet proof glass.

dialogues.speaker: KORDA'S FEET
dialogues.text: step by step. The voices of prisoners, muffled behind thi glass.

dialogues.speaker: KORDA'S FACE
dialogues.text: trying to stay cool, his heart pounding. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda FREEZES, then slowly turns to FIND... A prison GUAR (#1) moving toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard then stops in front of him and holds up his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dropped your card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda takes THE CARD given to him by the bail bondsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are the scum of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tryin' to make a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda turns and walks out the door into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the final step before getting out of the building. A small room with another GUARD (Latino; guard #2) behind g and several TV monitors. A BLACK WOMAN (forty-five) is ar with a LATINO GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to tell you, mam,  your brother ain't here. Try San  Bruno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came from San Bruno -- they  sent me here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Then I don't know where  he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda, fidgeting behind the woman impatiently, holds up h card...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, can I just sign outta here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you don't know  where he is?! You can't just lose  somebody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Korda) Who are you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Hawkins. Bail Bonds. I gotta  be over at county in fifteen minutes,  alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Korda) Can you believe these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the criminal justice system.  What can I tell ya? It's a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard shoves the sheet under the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, just sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda signs the sheet. The guard pushes a button. The met lock SNAPS, and the door POPS open. Korda takes his card sticks it in the woman's coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you find him, gimme a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Korda walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small parking area, with security gates on either  end, and a ceiling of heavy steel wire open to the sky. T are three or four CARS parked against the wall. Korda che inside the first car, looking for keys and finds none. Th the second, and the third until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda turns sharply to find the LATINO GUARD (guard #2),  holding a clipboard, walking quickly toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard walks up to him. They're standing between the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You signed out twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, why don't you just come on  back inside for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, lemme see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guard shows him the sign-in sheet, Korda removes t PEN from his own clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's funny, I wonder how  that happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash, Korda PLUNGES the pen DEEP into the guard's  throat. The BLOOD jumps out of his throat, onto the windo of the car as the guard, gagging in stunned silence, slum to ground. He then falls backward between the two cars,  drowning in his own blood.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. New front door. Unpainted. Frame splintered from w Roper shot it open. We hold a beat... HEAR ROPER & RO coming up the stairs. Laughing. The door opens. They ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come in those foreign movies the  young girl is always with some fat,  old guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Europe women find older men very  sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get old and fat, I'm moving  to Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie suddenly remembers something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to leave food for Paco.  He's probably starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks back toward the kitchen. Roper takes a seat on couch. Flips on the TV. Rubs the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, my eyes are tired from reading  that movie.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING RONNIE
dialogues.text: She moves down the hall to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doggie voice) I'm sorry, Paco. I forgot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Paco isn't lying on his pillow like she expected. Cur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around walks back down the hall... Where could be?... She walks into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in here either... She walks back into the hallwa Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDEN CUT
dialogues.text: A figure leaps out of the bathroom doorway!... Big scare. It's Paco. He nearly knocked her over. He stands on his h legs, paws on her shoulders. Breathing in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paco, have you been eating my face  soap, again?

dialogues.speaker: RACK FOCUS
dialogues.text: Roper standing at the other end of the hallway. Tense as wire. Gun at his side. One look at his demeanor tells Ron something is very wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very concerned) What is it, Scottie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper untenses. Puts away his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think he'll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice trails off. He can see she's worried now, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm on edge a little. Let's  relax. I'm sure he's just going to  try to get out of town. Anyway we  leave tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we do some of that European  movie stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her arms around his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're old and fat  enough for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE looking up at her window... The light goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A suitcase THUMPS to the ground. Looks like somebody pack for a six month trip around the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall grimaces as he lugs the bag toward the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you packed everything? Maybe  you forgot your bowling ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie stands on the doorstep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent that ahead, wise guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paco is on the sidewalk exploring from tree to tree. Rope calls to Ronnie from the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come back up with me,  Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll stand out here in the  sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper is still very edgy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better if you stay inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs up the stairs toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to calm down --

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper reaches the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie, come on baby, we gotta go.  Time to get movin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper moves into the room, listening. There's no response

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ronnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer. He calls out again, moving through th living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ronnie, where are you? Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer, the room is very quiet. Roper eases his PISTOL out from under his shirt, moving more urgently now, check out the bathroom, bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he HEARS Paco, WHINING. He moves around the entrance the kitchen. The back door is open, Paco standing in the  doorway. Roper rushes forward, quickly looking outside, t alley way empty. He senses a presence behind him, spinnin McCall standing in the doorway to the kitchen. Roper's lowers the weapon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall sees on the kitchen table, a folded piece of GLASS PAPER, just like the one Korda gave Roper at the jewelry  store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Scott...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper sees it, approaching, barely able to unfold the edg a momentary tremble in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch. If he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN as his fingers open the paper... revealing ins a MICRO CASSETTE TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to himself) He's fucking with you, Scott, be  cool... keep your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a TAPE RECORDER, Korda's VOICE heard over the  speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I got your lady, Roper. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and McCall are listening closely to the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You got something that belongs to  me, and I want it back. (beat) Twelve-fifteen, Mare Island, North  Entrance off Dixon. Building twenty- eight, by the dry docks. (beat) I so much as smell another cop, I'll  be sending you parts of this bitch  for a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper punches off the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna kill her no matter what.  If I take him these jewels he's gonna  kill me and her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a chance I gotta take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we better get moving... But  there's no way we can get the jewels  out of evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper stares at him, the wheels beginning to turn...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper is standing at the counter to the steel-caged prope room. On the other side is FRANK, the property sergeant o duty. The two men speak in hushed, urgent tones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, we go back a long way but you  can't expect me to do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, this guy is a psychopath and  he's got Ronnie. It's the only way  I'm going to get close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go to the Lieutenant or the  D.A. with it, for Christsakes. You're  asking me to put my fucking job on  the line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll never approve it, you know  that. Besides, I involve the  department and she's dead. I got one  chance with this guy, Frank, alone. (beat) He killed Sam and he'll kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank just stares at him, compassion and anger tearing at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What if it were Mary? (beat) You'd break every fucking rule in  the book... wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank continues to stare at him, a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope to God I never have to make  that decision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes back from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...and this conversation never  happened. I never saw you today. Now  I gotta go take a leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks away. Roper looks down, SEEING that th drawer beneath Frank's counter has been left slightly ope Roper reaches over, easing it further open -- inside a se of KEYS. He looks around, then takes the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you one, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the SATCHEL Korda used in the robbery. WIDEN TO REVEAL Roper and McCall, Roper at the wheel, McC reading a folded MAP featuring MARE ISLAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mare Island is an abandoned shipyard,  cranes, high buildings... he'll be  in place where he can see everything. (to Roper) How are we going to get me in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper thinks a moment, then turns, looking out the back o the pickup, in the bed a loose CANVAS TARPAULIN. He and M study the tarp a beat, then turn, looking at each other..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE VIEW reveals the immensity of the abandoned facility At one end near the chain link fence, Roper's pickup  approaches the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper cautiously drives toward the gate -- the CHAIN secu the gate has been cut. Roper swings open the gate. As he drives past we see that the bed of the truck has be loosely covered with a TARP. Roper drives on, winding through the maze of roadways, hu buildings and equipment dwarfing the truc PRODUCTION NOTE The idea is to take us into the facility to sell that it' abandoned, immense, eerie in it's scale -- a ghost town. end up wherever we want for the next scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he rounds a corner, approaching the dry dock area, hug CRANES and mothballed SHIPS in the b.g. He parks near a  building, a weathered SIGN reading: BLD 28. Roper shuts o the engine, leaving the keys in the ignition. Taking the  satchel he opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper steps out, eyes scanning the buildings, the cranes. Korda could be anywhere up there, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KORDA'S POV through the filthy windows, Roper far below,  standing beside his pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves away from the truck, holding the satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response he HEARS Korda's VOICE, eerie, almost a whisp coming from everywhere and nowhere as if emanating from t ground and the buildings all at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Nice of you to make it, Roper. Take  your jacket off, put it on the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper complies, his eyes searching the buildings, where i his voice coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now, over to the chains, to your  left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper SEES a chained off section nearby. Roper takes a fe steps when Korda's voice stops him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But first, let's have a look under  the tarp. Pull it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A momentary anxious look from Roper, then he walks to the bed of the truck, pausing a moment, gripping the cover be whipping it back, revealing... Ronnie's LUGGAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall supported under the frame by a makeshift HARNESS a his waist and legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, move it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall watches as Roper heads away, then releases the har lowering himself to the ground. Quickly he moves the SMOK LEATHER GLOVES he was wearing, burned by contact with the hot exhaust pipe.

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Reaches the the chained area, REVEALING an empty DRY DOCK easily one hundred feet deep and five hundred long. At the bottom of the dry dock is a PORTABLE RADIO, the  acoustics of natural amphitheater so intense you could he a whisper -- the source of Korda's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Throw in and your piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper tosses his PISTOL into the dry dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper removes the PISTOL from his ankle HOLSTER, tossing Korda's VOICE cuts the eerie silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Walk under the cranes and down the  alleyway. At the end, turn right.  Building thirty-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADIO CLICKS OFF. Roper walks towards the megalith CRANES, passing under th then heads down the alleyway created by the tall building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall, his RIFLE CASE on his chest, watches as Roper tur the corner and heads down the alley way.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: McCall rolls out, scrambling for the cover of the buildin Slinging the case over his shoulder he finds a LADDER lea up the side of the building, beginning to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking down the alley way, nearing the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall moving along the edge, looking down. He spots Rope moving fast to keep him in sight. He comes to the edge of the building, having to walk acro a narrow RAMP to get to the next building. He looks down, Roper turning the corner, McCall moves on, removing the RIFLE from its case as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaves the alleyway, a complex of hanger-like buildings  revealed. To his far right is a building, a SIGN reading: BLD 36. He clutches the satchel, heading towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall negotiating another precarious crossing between  buildings. He spots Roper, eyes quickly searching the roo tops and buildings for the sniper's position. He sees it, across the way, a location covering the buildings where R is now walking. He heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking towards building 36, passing by a towering, glass fronted building on his right, his eyes are searching the roof tops of the buildings around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Where the hell are you, McCall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Roper passes a set of partially open ROLLING DOORS to glass-fronted building, he's startled by Korda's VOICE fr within:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there, Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper's eyes go to building 36, still fifty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper stops, slowly turning towards the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in, there's someone just  dying to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper hesitates. He turns a bit in profile, eyes searchin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV TELESCOPIC SIGHT: Focusing on Roper, his lips moving. McCall, heaving for breath, has just dropped down into  position, providing a view of Roper and the inside of the glass fronted building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here, Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches the LASER SIGHTING attachment to his scope, a beam activated...

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: From inside the building Korda's VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your ass in here, Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Roper starts to move he SEES the red laser DOT on the back of his hand -- McCall is up there, right behind  him. Roper moves inside.

dialogues.speaker: MCCALL
dialogues.text: Lying prone inside the operator's booth, steadies his RIF looking through the scope. TELESCOPIC POV: He can see Roper enter, his field of visi limited inside the building where the light penetrates, t room cast in HARD SHADOWS. He MOVES to the windows, all either painted white or so  obscured with grime and dirt he can only see vague shapes and shadows inside. He MOVES BACK to the opening, Roper n just inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay cool, real easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavernous and dark, a jungle of huge MACHINES, LATHES and EQUIPMENT once used in the design of nuclear submarines. Roper moves a few feet inside, remaining in the light and keeping his face in three-quarter profile to McCall's  position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she, Korda? I want to see  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the darkness beyond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper walks to a steel SHOP TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Open your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not wearing a wire. This is just  between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up and do what I say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper puts down the satchel, unbuttoning his shirt, holdi it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the bag, dump everything on the  table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper opens the bag, the JEWELRY and the dozens of GLASSI ENVELOPES spill out onto the table. He lays the satchel o its side, the bottom facing Roper. Taped to the bottom is short barreled .45 AUTOMATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spread it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper spreads the pile out across the top of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the jewels, Korda, you've got  my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking Roper reaches to the pile of GLASSINE  ENVELOPES...

dialogues.speaker: ROPER'S HAND
dialogues.text: Palmed in his hand, the ENVELOPE containing Ronnie's diam Roper, without looking, 'digs' into the pile, holding up GLASSINE ENVELOPE between his fingers, still holding the  palmed envelope. He starts to toss the envelope in his  fingers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Not that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper hesitates, then drops the envelope, his hand moving over the pile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Right there, the one in front...  yeah, that one. Toss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper reaches for the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: ROPER'S HAND
dialogues.text: As he flips the palmed envelope into his fingers with the skill of a card shark, exchanging it for the one Korda  indicated. He tosses it across the room... From the shadows Korda's hand reaches out, picking it up. long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm impressed. I didn't think you  could do it. What did you have to  do, steal them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry) That's not going to look too good on  your service record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll worry about that. Let's get on  with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda LAUGHS as he slowly emerges from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sentiments exactly.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: On the floor he SEES a shadow cast - Korda. He moves to t windows... inside the vague, blurred OUTLINE of a man. Hi scope goes back to the satchel and the .45 taped to the  bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for the right moment, Scott...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda moves closer to the light, tossing an ATHLETIC BAG Roper, in his hand an AUTOMATIC PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill it up. Just in case there's a  homing device in the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper slides the jewels into the second bag, eyeing the . on the bottom of the satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now bring it over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper hesitates, but all he can do at this point is play time, he moves forward...

dialogues.speaker: DAY TELESCOPIC SCOPE
dialogues.text: Watching Roper as he moves away from the satchel and the  gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves the SCOPE ahead of Roper, SEEING Korda's shadow  cast on the floor, still unable to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) All right, Scott, bring him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper growing closer to Korda's position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's far enough. Bag on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper hangs onto the bag -- there's 'four million in jewe in there -- all he has to bargain with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've kept my end. Ronnie first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda reacts in mock surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, in all the excitement I  almost forgot. She right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIGHT SWITCH is thrown, a bank of lights behind him com ON, illuminating a massive FLAT BED CIRCULAR LATHE. Roper eyes in horror go to...

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Tied to the lathe bed spread eagle. Some distance from he body a CUTTING DEVICE is positioned over the lathe bed. Roper looks into Ronnie's terrified eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be cool, Ronnie, I'm gonna get you  out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back, Korda grinning at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit, this I gotta see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda swings into position a CONTROL BOX, the buttons hel down with TAPE. Korda pulls free the tape, the huge lathe beginning to TU very slowly, the cutting device activated... if the table keeps turning, Ronnie's body will soon be under the blade (PRODUCTION NOTE: Lathe will be cutting into a section of steel plate, demonstrating what will happen to Ronnie. Korda presses the STOP BUTTON, the lathe stopping. He rel his finger again, the lathe turning. He stops it. We can see that Korda is immensely proud of his 'creation his focus more on sadistic payback than anything else at  this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Fuckin' cool, huh? I rewired the  switch. You see, you have to keep  your finger on the button or the  little lady gets cut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He releases the button, the lathe turning towards the cut device. He stops it again, holding the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; grins) Right in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eases towards Roper, extending his arm on the control  box, holding the button down.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Through the SCOPE, he can see Korda as he steps into view The CROSSHAIRS settle on Korda's upper forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it right there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His finger tightens on the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda holds the control box towards Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then, that's not my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He releases the button and the box, the lathe turning, Ko grinning at Roper...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The RED DOT centered on Korda's forehead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light's out, fucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Roper's HEAD fills the scope, the red dot GLOWIN on the back of his head. In shock, McCall releases his finger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper moving to the control box, pressing the stop button stopping the lathe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, it's out of my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper looks at the box, Ronnie's life literally in his  hands...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Through the SCOPE, Roper's head blocking the shot to Kord

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper, move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Korda bends down, picking up the BAG, stepping back a from Roper, clearly out of McCall's line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hate to run but I've got a  plane to catch. You take good care  of the little lady, hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Korda walks down the corridor of the huge machine shop we now SEE a CAR parked near the end facing us. Korda sud stops, turning, gesturing to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How careless of me. You see, there's  only one way out of here, and you're  standing right in the way. (grins) You could move, but then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head at Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sure hate to be in your shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, walking quickly towards his car, TALKING, LAUGH to himself. Roper looks to the car, then back at the SATCHEL where th .45 is still taped to the bottom. But Roper can't move, u to change his position more than a foot or two. He looks  around him, no way to stop the lathe if he releases the  button.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: He can see Roper holding the box, but nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Korda reaches his car, hopping inside, STARTING it up In desperation Roper looks back at the satchel, then turn calling out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall, stop him, stop the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda REVVING the engine...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: McCall reading Roper's lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings the SCOPE up but the back of the machine shop i blocked by his vantage point. Then he HEARS the faint SQUEALING of tires. He lowers his scope, holding, waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda at the end of the long building, beginning to  accelerate.

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Turns toward McCall's position...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAR now screaming down the long corridor...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: McCall still can't see the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car now closing in on Roper, but Roper holds his grou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall, shoot the son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda bearing down on Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, bye, cop...

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Holding his position, eyes widening in fear...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The CAR comes into view, the CROSSHAIRS on the windshield but the glare off the window is obscuring any shot of Kor McCall takes aim and FIRES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet punches through the window, catching Korda's l shoulder, BLOOD flying. Korda whips the wheel in shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning out of control, hitting a table piled with MACHI PARTS, sending them flying... But the car is now swapping ends, still flying right towa Roper, who can't move...; who won't move. The car flies past him, the SIDE MIRROR catching Roper's  shirt, tearing it, a flash of BLOOD from his arm... The car then collides with a series of PIPES crossing the floor, STEAM erupting in every direction as the car then  slams into several PROPANE BOTTLES stacked near the bench a series of EXPLOSIONS ripping through the building. . .

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Thrown to the floor by the explosions, releasing the butt as...

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: Hits the GLASSED-IN ROLLING DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The CAR explodes from the building, GLASS FLYING, the car rolling, flipping over, coming to a rest on its wheels,  driver's side away from McCall's position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, recovering. He catches a quick glimpse of t bottom section of the lathe, a GEARBOX, the gears turning

dialogues.speaker: THE LATHE
dialogues.text: Turning, the cutting blade inching towards Ronnie...

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Staggers to his feet, grabbing the control box, pressing button... nothing happens, the lathe still turning, SPARK coming out of the box, it's SHORTING... Only a few more  seconds... Desperately his eyes search the floor, SEEING a HUGE WREN He grabs the wrench, jamming it between the GEARS in the  gearbox, the gears shuddering violently, threatening to c the wrench... Roper runs to Ronnie's side, frantically pulling at her b the cutting blade now paused an inch away from her...

dialogues.speaker: THE GEARBOX
dialogues.text: Hammering and clanking, the wrench can't last a heartbeat longer...

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Pulls the last of the restraints away...

dialogues.speaker: THE GEARBOX
dialogues.text: Just as the massive gears crush the wrench, the table  turning...

dialogues.speaker: THE LATHE
dialogues.text: The blade passing directly over Ronnie's position as Rope hauls her away, holding her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Korda is slumped over the wheel. He looks dead. McCall sl his rifle over his shoulder and moves towards a DRAIN PIP attached to the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper holding Ronnie, easing her away from the still turn lathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, Scottie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over, babe, it's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall slides to the ground via the drain pipe, but...

dialogues.speaker: KORDA'S CAR
dialogues.text: Korda is not quite dead... The door eases open, Korda rolling to the ground, bag in hand, AUTOMATIC in the other. He looks up, SEEING McCall. He OPENS FIRE, McCall hitting the deck and taking cover a BULLETS hit the wall around him. McCall whips out his REVOLVER, RETURNING FIRE, a GUN BATT ensuing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEARING the shots outside, hauls Ronnie out of the way,  keeping her low to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes her towards the cover of some machines, then  crouching low to the floor, recovers the .45 from the bot of the satchel. He heads out towards the other side of th cavernous, machine-choked building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRES a round at Korda, then trying to close in on the ca runs from his cover into the opening...

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: Leaps up and FIRES, McCall taking a slug in his leg, knoc him to the ground. The SLIDE to Korda's AUTOMATIC has kic open, out of bullets. He drops the gun, picks up the BAG runs alongside the machine shop.

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Exits the machine shop, SEEING McCall on the ground, Kord nowhere in sight. Combat-style Roper runs to McCall, drop to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) I'm okay. Korda... went down the  side of the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper sprints towards the building, racing alongside it,  catching a glimpse of Korda just as he disappears around other end. Roper charges on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda runs past the building, still clutching the BAG. He runs past another building, heading towards the dry dock  area and Roper's pickup. A moment later Roper emerges fro the machine shop just in time to see Korda round the corn of the next building.

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: Clearing the building sees Roper's PICKUP. He runs to it, jumping inside, finding the KEYS in the ignition. He star the truck, pulling out, just as Roper runs into view.

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: With the truck accelerating towards him he raises and FIR two bullet holes in the front WINDSHIELD, missing Korda, truck still speeding towards him. Roper's gun jams. Roper leaps, sliding forward on the hood, almost falling as he  grabs on to the empty window frame and the windshield wip blades for support, his WEAPON flying from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: Speeds around the buildings and down the alleyways, whipp from side to side, trying to shake Roper off, Roper hangi on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Give it up, Korda, you got away with  nothing! Nothing but a bag of shit!  It's all fake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda can't help but look at the OPEN BAG beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Go on, you stupid fuck, look at it!  It's all shit! A hundred dollars  worth of glass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda reaches in, grabbing a handful of the COSTUME JEWEL He can't believe it, it's all fake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fuck!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korda goes crazy, slamming the truck into the side of a  building, trying to throw Roper, but Roper hangs on. Korda then caroms off the sides of buildings, left, right SPARKS flying, then smashes into BOXES, CRATES, anything can see stacked alongside the road way, but Roper stays p clinging on with all he's got, swinging from side to side avoid the obstacles. Then Korda SEES ahead a huge pile of BOXES, WOOD FRAMING, PALLETS, TRASH, stacked at the side of a building. He ham the pedal, driving the right side of the truck into the  pile... BOXES, WOOD, PAPER, DEBRIS flying everywhere, thr the open fron window as well, Korda shielding his eyes wi his arm as OBJECTS fly around in a mad flurry inside the  cab...

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: In the maelstrom lets go his grip, grabbing the upper fra of the window and assisted by the speed of the truck, rol over the top of the cab, landing in the bed of the truck  along with BOXES, LUMBER, and TRASH.

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: Clears his eyes, looking up, Roper is gone! He LAUGHS  hysterically... he knocked him off!

dialogues.speaker: ROPER IN THE BED OF THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Leaning out the passenger's side SEES they are approachin the dry dock area. In the bed of the truck, along with the BOXES, SUITCASES other objects, he sees several long 2x4's. Grabbing a BOA he braces himself against the cab and then in one swift  movement, stands, swinging to the driver's side, driving 2x4 through the side window, through the steering wheel,  past the dash and catching the tip of the ACCELERATOR PED pinning it to the floor. As Roper releases the board it WEDGES inside the door fra locking the wheel and the accelerator, the engine SCREAMI wide open. Korda reacts in panic... Roper clings to the cab, looking over the top, the DRY DO looming towards them. He prepares to jump...

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: Suddenly SEES the approaching dry dock. He jams on the br but it's not enough, the truck racing towards the edge...

dialogues.speaker: IN SLOW MOTION THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Vaults over the edge of the dry dock as Roper runs down t bed, leaping off the tail gate, arms windmilling as he go airborne... The truck plummets towards the bottom...

dialogues.speaker: ROPER
dialogues.text: Lands in a huge pile of CARGO NETS and CARDBOARD BOXES, p near the edge of the dry dock...

dialogues.speaker: KORDA
dialogues.text: SCREAMS in wide-eyed terror as...

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Hits the bottom of the dock, EXPLODING into flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper and Ronnie lay on a gorgeous white sand beach, drin from coconuts with umbrellas in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen sea so blue. Tahiti  is magnificent, Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could get used to this  Paradise shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper hails a waitress, serving the hotel guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to waitress) I'll have another Pena Colada. And  this time could you shave the ice,  please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui, Monsieur. Right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roper stretches back into his chaise lounge, adjusting hi Ray Bans. A purring cat without a care in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO GORGEOUS FRENCH GIRLS unstring their bikinis, floppin topless on the beach in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have been going pretty well  between us, haven't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing something's  up) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've changed you know. I don't  think there's anything you can't do  once you put your mind to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. He removes his shades to get a better look at the  curve ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking... (here it comes) There's something special I want to  talk to you about. (he's listening) I think it's time we went to a whole  other phase in our relationship. (pointedly) A deeper level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no longer relaxed,  sitting up) A deeper level?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. We've got to bare it  all. Here and now. 'Cause I think  I'm finally ready to go for it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off at  the pass) Whoa! Wait a minute, Ronnie. Hold  on. I know it's beautiful here. The  sun, the sand, the sea and all that  nature shit can really get to you.  But we've got to keep our perspective  here. This place isn't real. This  isn't reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I said this trip should be a  'roadtest'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about... What are you  talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about me 'n' you stripping  down on this beach and gettin' you  know... 'naked in Tahiti'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talkin' about gettin' 'nekked?' (off her look) Shit, I thought you were talkin'  bout, you know... the "M" word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought I was talking about  getting married?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs her amazing laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about taking our clothes  off, silly. You said you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AD LIBS dialogue below as CAMERA CRANES BACK and we ROLL  CREDITS over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy? With all those people  around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what you are?! You're a prude,  Roper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Prude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you want me to put on one of  those skinny ass bathing suits --  tongs or thongs or whatever you call  them -- with my butt cheeks wrapped  around a piece of dental floss... No  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over her laughter we...
